analyzed: yām sāṃkhya yoga vidvāṃsaḥ gatim mohāt prapedire

analyzed: vedānta jñāna vidvāṃsaḥ gatim icchanti vaidikīm

original: pāñcarātraratā ye ca ye ca yogimaheśvarāḥ /
analyzed: pāñcarātra ratāḥ ye ca ye ca yogi maheśvarāḥ
translated: Those who are devoted to the Pancharatra, and those who are great yogis and Maheshvaras,

original: pramāṇāgneyakartṛtvaviśikhāmalakārakāḥ //
translated: who are the makers of the flame of the fire of valid means of knowledge,

original: pravadanti malāsiddhā ye cānye mokṣavādinaḥ /
analyzed: pravadanti mala asiddhāḥ ye ca anye mokṣa vādinaḥ
translated: and others who proclaim the doctrine of liberation, who are not accomplished in the impurities,

original: iti rauravasūtram
analyzed: iti raurava sūtram
translated: Thus is the Raurava Sutra.

original: tadiyatā śivahastasya prādhānyaṃ pratipādyādhunā dīkṣāphalasya pramāṇasya
analyzed: tat iyatā śivahastasya prādhānyam pratipādya adhunā dīkṣā phalasya pramāṇasya
translated: Having thus explained the importance of Shiva's hand, now, in order to show the fruits of initiation,

original: tāvad vyatirekeṇa samānāsamānatantrāntaragītāni phalāni darśayituṃ yāṃ
analyzed: tāvat vyatirekeṇa samāna asamāna tantra antara gītāni phalāni darśayitum yām
translated: in order to show the fruits mentioned in other Tantras, which are equal and unequal by way of exclusion, he

original: sāṃkhyayogavidvāṃsa ityādeḥ sārdhasūtradvayasya kārikābhirarthamāha
analyzed: sāṃkhya yoga vidvāṃsaḥ ityādeḥ sārdha sūtra dvayasya kārikābhiḥ artham āha
translated: says the meaning of the two and a half sutras beginning with those who are learned in Samkhya and Yoga with the verses.

original: satsaṃskārasya yasyedamaṅgajātaṃ nirūpitam /
analyzed: sat saṃskārasya yasya idam aṅga jātam nirūpitam
translated: For him whose this group of limbs is described, having good impressions,

original: tatphalavyatirekāya yaduktaṃ phalavarṇanam // //
analyzed: tad phala vyatirekāya yat uktam phala varṇanam
translated: the description of the fruits that is said is for the exclusion of its fruits.

original: yasya śivahastādīnyaṅgāni dattapūrvāṇi / tasya saṃskārasyā
analyzed: yasya śiva hasta ādīni aṅgāni datta pūrvāṇi tasya saṃskārasya ā
translated: For him whose limbs such as Shiva's hand etc. have been given before, for that impression,

original: yogānyayogavyavacchedenāpavargakāraṇatvataḥ saditi viśeṣitasya dīkṣākhyasya yatphalaṃ
analyzed: yoga anya yoga vyavacchedena apavarga kāraṇatvataḥ sat iti viśeṣitasya dīkṣā ākhyasya yat phalam
translated: by excluding yoga and non-yoga, being the cause of final liberation, the fruit of that initiation called diksha, which is qualified as good,

original: vakṣyamāṇamaśeṣabandhanivṛttau svaguṇasarvajñatvādyabhivyaktiḥ / tadbhedena tantrāntaragītāni
analyzed: vakṣyamāṇam aśeṣa bandha nivṛttau sva guṇa sarvajña tva ādi abhivyaktiḥ tad bhedena tantra antara gītāni
translated: The manifestation of one's own qualities such as omniscience upon the cessation of all bondage as will be described. The Gītās in other scriptures are different from that.

original: phalāni varṇyante / phalabhedakathanaprayojanaṃ vakṣyatyupasaṃhāre tatsādhaneṣu
analyzed: phalāni varṇyante phala bheda kathana prayojanam vakṣyati upasaṃhāre tad sādhaneṣu
translated: The manifestation of one's own qualities such as omniscience upon the cessation of all bondage, which will be described later. The fruits mentioned in other scriptures are described according to the difference in that. The purpose of stating the difference in fruits will be stated in the conclusion by saying

original: ityādinā // //
analyzed: ityādinā
translated: Thus, etc.

original: tatra krameṇa tānuddiśati
analyzed: tatra krameṇa tān uddiśati
translated: There, he mentions them in order:

original: kaivalyaṃ sattvasaṃbhogo vilayaḥ paramātmani /
analyzed: kaivalyam sattva saṃbhogaḥ vilayaḥ paramātmani
translated: Liberation, enjoyment of existence, dissolution in the supreme self,

original: avyākṛtādiṣvarvāktvaṃ laya eva vikāriṣu // //🔽guṇatrayalakṣaṇaprakṛtisambandho hyakevalatāheturātmanaḥ / sa ca na🔽sambandhamātram / tayorvyāpakatvādātmanaḥ kaivalyāvasthāyāmapi tasya bhāvāt
analyzed: avyākṛta ādiṣu arvāk tvam layaḥ eva vikāriṣu  guṇatraya lakṣaṇa prakṛti sambandhaḥ hi akevala tā hetuḥ ātmanaḥ sa ca na  sambandha mātram tayoḥ vyāpaka tvāt ātmanaḥ kaivalya avasthāyām api tasya bhāvāt
translated: Being below the unmanifest, etc., and dissolution itself in the evolvents.🔽Indeed, the connection with Prakṛti, characterized by the three qualities, is the cause of non-isolation for the self. And that is not🔽mere connection. Because of their pervasiveness and the existence of that even in the state of isolation of the self,

original: tathātvānupapatteḥ / api tu bhoktṛbhogyarūpo'nādistadavivekapratipattyātmakaḥ /
analyzed: tathātva anupapatteḥ api tu bhoktṛ bhogya rūpa ūna ādiḥ tad aviveka pratipatti ātmakaḥ
translated: it is not possible for it to be so. Rather, it is beginningless in the form of the enjoyer and the enjoyed, consisting of the realization of non-discrimination between them.

original: pratyayāvivekarūpatvād bhoktṛbhāvasya / yadāhuḥ pratyayāviveko bhogaḥ iti /
analyzed: pratyaya aviveka rūpa tvāt bhoktṛ bhāvasya yat āhuḥ pratyaya avivekaḥ bhogaḥ iti
translated: Because the state of being an enjoyer is of the nature of non-discrimination of the means of knowledge. As they say, Enjoyment is the non-discrimination of the means of knowledge.

original: prakṛtirhyātmānaṃ bhogyatvena samarpayantyapi
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ hi ātmānam bhogya tvena samarpayanti api
translated: Indeed, Prakṛti, even though it presents the self as the object of enjoyment,

original: puṃsastamaḥsāmarthyopārjitakleśabhūtāvidyāsmitādiśaktiyogena tathā samarpayantī
analyzed: puṃsaḥ tamaḥ sāmarthya upārjita kleśa bhūta avidyā asmitā ādi śakti yogena tathā samarpayantī
translated: It thus presents itself to the soul, through the association of the powers of ignorance, egoism, etc., which are the afflictions acquired by the soul's power of darkness.

original: vidagdhaveśyāvanna yathā tadvikāraśeṣeṣu tasya heyatvabuddhirupajāyate / anyathā
analyzed: vidagdha veśyā vat na yathā tad vikāra śeṣeṣu tasya heya tva buddhiḥ upajāyate anyathā
translated: Like a clever prostitute, it does not produce in him the notion of its being to be abandoned in the remaining modifications of itself. Otherwise,

original: tadatiriktabandhāsiddherbhogāyogāt /
analyzed: tad atirikta bandha asiddheḥ bhoga ayogāt
translated: because the bondage other than that would not be established, there would be no possibility of enjoyment.

original: saṃskārābhāvaprasaṅgāt / sa eva ca saṃskāraḥ kaivalyapratipakṣabhūtaḥ procyate /
analyzed: saṃskāra abhāva prasaṅgāt saḥ eva ca saṃskāraḥ kaivalya pratipakṣa bhūtaḥ procyate
translated: And that very impression is said to be the counteragent to liberation.

original: yadā tvātmajñānād yogādvā tasmāt puṃsaḥ svarūpeṇa bhāsvareṇānanyarūṣitena
analyzed: yadā tu ātma jñānāt yogāt vā tasmāt puṃsaḥ sva rūpeṇa bhāsvareṇa ananya rūṣitena
translated: But when, through knowledge of the Self or through yoga, that discrimination becomes manifest to the soul through its own radiant nature, not obscured by anything else,

original: vivekaḥ prakāśate / tadānīṃ tenāvivekasya pratipakṣatayaivāpadhvaṃsitatvāt tadātmakasyāpi
analyzed: vivekaḥ prakāśate tadānīm tena avivekasya pratipakṣa tayā evā apadhvaṃsita tvāt tad ātmakasya api
translated: then, because that [discrimination] has destroyed non-discrimination by being its counteragent, even that which consists of it,

original: prasārasya taṃ pratyanudayāt sarvātmanā prakṛterbhogyatvanivṛttau tasya paraṃ kaivalyaṃ
analyzed: prasārasya tam pratyanudayāt sarva ātmanā prakṛteḥ bhogya tva nivṛttau tasya param kaivalyam
translated: the expansion, does not arise in relation to it. When the entire nature ceases to be an object of enjoyment, for him there is supreme liberation,

original: muktiriti tacchāstravitpravarāḥ /
analyzed: muktiḥ iti tad śāstra vid pravarāḥ
translated: which is called release. This is what the foremost knowers of the scriptures say.

original: phalāntaramāha sattvasaṃbhoga ityādinā / anādireva prakṛtisaṃbandhaḥ / puruṣo
analyzed: phala antaram āha sattva saṃbhogaḥ ityādinā anādiḥ eva prakṛti saṃbandhaḥ
translated: He states another result beginning with the enjoyment of existence, etc. The connection with nature is beginningless. The soul is

original: bhoktṛtayā sarvairabhyupagataḥ / na ca tadbhoktṛtvamaupādhikam / tasya tathātve hi tasya na tat
analyzed: bhoktṛtayā sarvaiḥ abhyupagataḥ na ca tad bhoktṛ tvam aupādhikam tasya tathātve hi tasya na tat
translated: It is accepted by all as the enjoyer. And that state of being the enjoyer is not adventitious. For if it were so, it would not be that.

original: syāt / anyakṛtasya dharmasya nityakarmavyatikarāyogāt / vyatikare vā nāsau bhokteti kasya bandho
analyzed: syāt anya kṛtasya dharmasya nitya karma vyatikara ayogāt vyatikare vā na asau bhoktā iti kasya bandho
translated: For it is not proper that the dharma produced by another should be mixed with the eternal action. Or if there were a mixture, it would not be the enjoyer. Whose bondage

original: mokṣo veti bhoktṛtvaṃ svabhāvātmakameṣṭavyam / na cānādernityasvabhāvasya vināśo
analyzed: mokṣaḥ vā iti bhoktṛ tvam svabhāva ātmakam eṣṭavyam na ca anādeḥ nitya svabhāvasya
translated: or liberation is it? Therefore, the state of being the enjoyer must be accepted as having the nature of the Self. And the destruction of that which is beginningless and eternal by nature

original: yuktaḥ / kevale puruṣe'pi tathābhāvaprasaṅgato vaināśikatvaprāpteḥ /
analyzed: yuktaḥ kevale puruṣa ipi tathā bhāva prasaṅgataḥ vaināśika tva prāpteḥ
translated: is not proper. Because the consequence would be that it would be so even in the mere Purusha, and one would attain the state of being a nihilist.

original: tadvināśāsaṃbhavādeva ca muktāvapi bhoktṛbhogyasaṃbandhaḥ puṃprakṛtyoreṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: tad vināśa asaṃbhavāt eva ca muktau api bhoktṛ bhogya saṃbandhaḥ pum prakṛtyoḥ eṣṭavyaḥ
translated: And because the destruction of that is impossible, even in liberation the connection between the enjoyer and the object of enjoyment must be accepted for the Purusha and Prakriti.

original: kevalaṃ cānādikarmadaurātmyataḥ prāg duḥkhamohāntaritasukhalayarūpikā prakṛtistasya🔽bhogyā'bhūt / yatpunastatkāraṇabhūtasarvakarmapratyastatvam / yato muktau
analyzed: kevalam ca anādi karma daurātmyataḥ prāk duḥkha moha antarita sukha laya rūpikā prakṛtiḥ tasya  yat punar tad kāraṇa bhūta sarva karma pratyasta tvam yatas muktau
translated: And Prakriti, which was formerly of the nature of pleasure mixed with pain and delusion, was the object of enjoyment for him, due to the misfortune of beginningless actions.

original: śuddhanirantarānatiśayānavacchinnasattvātmasukharūpo'sau bhogya iti tatprāptāḥ kila
analyzed: śuddha nirantara anatiśaya anavacchinna sattva ātma sukha rūpaḥ usau bhogyaḥ iti tad prāptāḥ kila
translated: But when all the actions that are the cause of that are destroyed, he becomes the object of enjoyment in the form of the pure, uninterrupted, unsurpassed, undivided bliss of the Self. Therefore, it is said that those who have attained that🔽are liberated.

original: sattvabhujaḥ procyanta iti tadāgamavidāṃ pīṭhabandhaḥ /
analyzed: sattva bhujaḥ procyante iti tad āgama vidām pīṭhabandhaḥ
translated: This is the conclusion of those who know the scriptures.

original: vilayaḥ paramātmanīti śāstrāntaraphalam / sarvaṃ khalvidaṃ brahma /
analyzed: vilayaḥ paramātmani iti śāstra antara phalam sarvam khalu idam brahma chā u
translated: The dissolution into the supreme self is the result mentioned in other scriptures. All this is Brahman.

original: neha nānāsti kiñcana / / / / iti śrutilakṣaṇāt
analyzed: na iha nānā asti kiñcana iti śruti lakṣaṇāt
translated: Here there is nothing diverse at all.

original: siddhārthaviṣayalabdhaprāmāṇyādapauruṣeyatayā tadanyāgamebhyaḥ prabalatararūpādāgamāt🔽pratipannasya paramānandādyanekatadāgamagītaguṇasvabhāvasya pramāṇāntarā
analyzed: siddhārtha viṣaya labdha prāmāṇyāt apauruṣeya tayā tad anya āgamebhyaḥ prabalatara rūpāt āgamāt  pratipannasya parama ānanda ādi aneka tad āgama gīta guṇa svabhāvasya pramāṇa antarā
translated: From the Vedas, which have their authority established by their subject matter, and which are more powerful than other scriptures because they are not of human origin,

original: gocarānavacchinnacidbrahmaṇaḥ satyatayā tadanyeṣāṃ ca bhedarūpā
analyzed: gocara anavacchinna cit brahmaṇaḥ satya tayā tad anyeṣām ca bheda rūpā
translated: The Brahman, which is consciousness not limited by the scope of other means of knowledge, is understood to be true, having the nature of the many qualities sung of in those scriptures, such as supreme bliss, and so on. And the others, which are of the nature of diversity,

original: ṇāmavidyādinirmāṇaikasāratvenāsatyatayā'vagatiḥ / tata eva ta āhuḥ ātmā yataḥ
analyzed: ṇāma vidyā ādi nirmāṇa eka sāra tvena asatya tayā avagatiḥ tatas eva te āhuḥ ātmā yatas
translated: Are understood to be false, having as their sole essence ignorance and so on. For this very reason they say, The self from which

original: prasiddhaṃ ca kavayo'sya pracakṣate iti / na cāsyāvagamasya
analyzed: prasiddham ca kavayaḥ usya pracakṣate iti na ca asya avagamasya
translated: And the wise declare it to be well known. And this understanding

original: bhedasattāpramāṇabhūtapratyakṣādibādhe agninā siñcedityāderivāprāmāṇyamāśaṅkanīyam /
analyzed: bheda sattā pramāṇa bhūta pratyakṣa ādi bādhe agninā siñcet ityādeḥ iva aprāmāṇyam āśaṅkanīyam
translated: Should not be suspected of being invalid, like One should sprinkle with fire, when contradicted by perception and other means of knowledge that are the evidence for the existence of diversity.

original: bhedasyetaretarābhāvaprasiddhivyapekṣatvena vastumātragrāhipratyakṣaviṣayatvāsiddheḥ /
analyzed: bhedasya itaretara abhāva prasiddhi vyapekṣa tvena vastu mātra grāhi pratyakṣa viṣaya tva asiddheḥ
translated: Because diversity is not established as the object of perception, which grasps only things, depending on the establishment of mutual absence.

original: śaśaviṣāṇavadavidyāmātrakalpitatvenāsatyatvāt / taduktam āhurvidhātṛ pratyakṣam
analyzed: śaśaviṣāṇa vat avidyā mātra kalpita tvena asatya tvāt tat uktam āhuḥ vidhātṛ pratyakṣam
translated: Because they are unreal, being merely imagined by ignorance, like the horn of a rabbit. This is stated: They declare the creator to be directly perceptible

original: iti / evaṃ ca sati jīvātmanāmapi
analyzed: iti evam ca sati jīvātmanām api
translated: . And in this case, even for the individual souls,

original: svataḥpramāṇasiddhaproktasatyabhūtaparamātmasāratve'pyavidyākaluṣitatvena bhrāntatvāt
analyzed: svatas pramāṇa siddha prokta satya bhūta paramātma sāra tve pi avidyā kaluṣita tvena bhrānta tvāt
translated: although they are essentially the true Supreme Self, established by self-validating cognition, due to being deluded by ignorance,

original: prasuptapuruṣasādhāraṇānāmiva svapnānubhavavṛttīnāṃ
analyzed: prasupta puruṣa sādhāraṇānām iva svapna anubhava vṛttīnām
translated: like the experiences in a dream common to a sleeping person,

original: tāttvikaprabodhānudayatastadrūpānupajñātabodhakaḥ saṃsārābhidhānabhedakaprapañcaḥ
analyzed: tāttvika prabodha anudayataḥ tad rūpa anupajñāta bodhakaḥ saṃsāra abhidhāna bhedaka prapañcaḥ
translated: the manifold world, called saṃsāra, which is not known by the cognition that has realized their true nature,

original: svarūpatoanidamprathamaḥ / kadācittu ātmā jñātavyaḥ ityādiśāstragītakrameṇa prodbalatara
analyzed: svarūpataḥ an idam prathamaḥ kadācid tu ātmā jñātavyaḥ ityādi śāstra gīta krameṇa prodbalatara
translated: is not manifest in its own nature. But sometimes, by the intensified

original: jñānaprāptitastatpratipakṣabhūtabhrāntikāraṇapronmūlanena tiraskṛtākhilabhrāntiḥ
analyzed: jñāna prāptitaḥ tad pratipakṣa bhūta bhrānti kāraṇa pronmūlanena tiraskṛta akhila bhrāntiḥ
translated: attainment of knowledge in the sequence sung by scriptures such as the Self should be known, by uprooting the causes of delusion, which are opposed to that, all delusion being suppressed,

original: paramātmabodhaḥ suptaprabuddhasyeva svarūpamātrapratiṣṭho jīvātmanaḥ
analyzed: paramātma bodhaḥ supta prabuddhasya iva svarūpa mātra pratiṣṭhaḥ jīvātmanaḥ
translated: the cognition of the Supreme Self, like that of a sleeping person who has awakened, is established in the individual soul's own nature alone,

original: pūrvapravāhavilayarūpo bhavatīti / saiva parā muktiriti keṣāñcid grahaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva pravāha vilaya rūpaḥ bhavati iti sā eva parā muktiḥ iti keṣāñcid grahaḥ
translated: and becomes the cessation of the previous current. This alone is the highest liberation, some think.

original: nanvatra vṛttikartuḥ pariṇativedāntamatirevoddeśyatayā'bhimatā na māyāvādamatiḥ /
analyzed: nanu atra vṛtti kartuḥ pariṇati vedānta matiḥ eva uddeśya tayā abhimatā na māyā vāda matiḥ
translated: Is not the Vedanta of Parināvists the intended object of the author of the commentary, not the Vedanta of the Māyāvādins?

original: saiva upādānatvasaṃsiddhiḥ iti vakṣyamāṇadūṣaṇānusāriṇī / satyaṃ
analyzed: sā eva upādāna tva saṃsiddhiḥ iti vakṣyamāṇa dūṣaṇa anusāriṇī satyam
translated: That itself is the establishment of the nature of the material cause, which will be followed by the criticism to be stated later. True,

original: tadanusāriṇī / kintu naiṣā vedānteṣvadhyātmavitpravarairmukhyatvena gīyate / na cātra
analyzed: tad anusāriṇī kintu nā eṣā vedānteṣu adhyātma vid pravaraiḥ mukhya tvena gīyate na ca atra
translated: it is followed by that. But this is not sung as primary by the best knowers of the Self in the Vedāntas. And here

original: śrutayo'nurūpāḥ / saiva ca yathā dūṣaṇānusāriṇī tathātraiva vakṣyamaḥ /
analyzed: śrutayaḥ nurūpāḥ sā eva ca yathā dūṣaṇa anusāriṇī tathā atra eva vakṣyamaḥ
translated: the śrutis are not in agreement. And just as it is followed by criticism, we will state it here itself.

original: avyākṛtādiṣvityāgamāntaraphaloddeśaḥ / yatra tiṣṭhantyaṇīyāṃsaḥ kṣetrajñāḥ
analyzed: avyākṛta ādiṣu iti āgama antara phala uddeśaḥ yatra tiṣṭhanti aṇīyāṃsaḥ kṣetrajñāḥ
translated: The intended result of another āgama is stated in in the unmanifested etc. Where the minute individual souls

original: karmabhiḥ saha / tadavyākṛtamucyate / kutra tiṣṭhanti / atra kecidāhuḥ iha yathā🔽mṛdanviteṣu
analyzed: karmabhiḥ saha tat avyākṛtam ucyate kutra tiṣṭhanti atra kecid āhuḥ iha yathā  mṛd anviteṣu
translated: dwell along with their actions, that is called the unmanifested. Where do they dwell? Here some say: Just as

original: ghaṭādiṣu mṛtkāryatvadarśanād bhavadbhiḥ sukhādyanviteṣvapi kāryakāraṇādiṣu
analyzed: ghaṭa ādiṣu mṛd kārya tva darśanāt bhavadbhiḥ sukha ādi anviteṣu api kārya kāraṇa ādiṣu
translated: in pots etc. which possess clay, the clay is seen to be the material cause, so you accept that in the effects and causes etc. which possess pleasure etc.,

original: sukhādirūpapradhānakāraṇatvamiṣyate / tathaivātmanāṃ pradhānasya ca
analyzed: sukha ādi rūpa pradhāna kāraṇa tvam iṣyate tathā eva ātmanām pradhānasya ca
translated: the primordial nature in the form of pleasure etc. is the material cause. In the same way, even though the souls and the primordial nature

original: bhede'pyekasadanvayasaṃbhavādekakāraṇatvamiṣyatām / atra vā tanmā bhūditi
analyzed: bhede pi eka sat anvaya saṃbhavāt eka kāraṇatvam iṣyatām atra vā tat mā bhūt iti
translated: are different, let their being the one cause be accepted because of the possibility of inherence in one substratum. Or let it not be so here.

original: viśeṣābhāvāt teṣāṃ yatkāraṇaṃ sā parā prakṛtirmahāvibhūtyabhidhānā / jaḍā
analyzed: viśeṣa abhāvāt teṣām yat kāraṇam sā parā prakṛtiḥ mahā vibhūti abhidhānā jaḍā
translated: The cause of those, which is the supreme nature, is called the great power, because it is the cause of the insentient.

original: jaḍakāraṇatvāt / saiva sākṣādīśvaralakṣaṇena cāturātmyenānīśvarakṣetrajñātmanā
analyzed: jaḍa kāraṇa tvāt sā eva sākṣāt īśvara lakṣaṇena cāturātmyena anīśvara kṣetrajña ātmanā
translated: It itself directly transforms into the four-fold nature characterized as the Lord, and into the nature of the non-Lord and the knower of the field,

original: jaḍātmakā'vidyārūpeṇa ca pariṇamate / vidyā tu buddhimanobhūtā aviśeṣāt tanmātratayā
analyzed: jaḍa ātmaka avidyā rūpeṇa ca pariṇamate vidyā tu buddhi manaḥ bhūtā aviśeṣāt tanmātra tayā
translated: and into the form of ignorance which is of the nature of the insentient. But knowledge, being of the nature of intellect and mind, is not different from that, and therefore🔽it transforms in that way, as the subtle elements,

original: bhūtāviśeṣācca bhūtatayā bhūtānīndriyatvenetyevaṃkrameṇa saiva tathā tathā pariṇamata
analyzed: bhūta aviśeṣāt ca bhūta tayā bhūtāni indriya tvena iti evaṃkrameṇa sā eva tathā tathā pariṇamata
translated: and as the elements, because of the non-distinction of the elements. And the elements transform into the senses. Thus it transforms in that way, in that way.

original: iti paratvaṃ tasyāḥ / tadāhuḥ bhagavān vāsudevaḥ parā prakṛtirjyāyasī vibhūtirbhūtireva
analyzed: iti para tvam tasyāḥ tat āhuḥ bhagavān vāsudevaḥ parā prakṛtiḥ jyāyasī vibhūtiḥ bhūtiḥ eva
translated: Therefore, it is supreme. The Blessed Lord Vāsudeva says: The supreme nature is greater, the power is the prosperity itself,

original: ca / sa svayaṃ bhavati bhūto bhāvītyevamaṇīyastayā avyāpakavyāpakatvena tatraiva
analyzed: ca sa svayam bhavati bhūtaḥ bhāvī iti evam aṇīyaḥ tayā avyāpaka vyāpaka tvena tatra eva
translated: and he himself becomes the existent and the non-existent. In this way, by being smaller, and by being the pervader and the pervaded, there🔽the knowers of the field abide, because of being the effect there itself.

original: kāryatvāt kṣetrajñāstiṣṭhantīti tata evopādānakāraṇād
analyzed: kārya tvāt kṣetrajñāḥ tiṣṭhanti iti tatas eva upādānakāraṇāt
translated: From that very material cause,

original: vikṛtidharmakādavidyākarmānubandhena jīvātmanāṃ sambhavāt / tatkṣayataḥ
analyzed: vikṛti dharmakāt avidyā karma anubandhena jīvātmanām sambhavāt tad kṣayataḥ
translated: because of the manifestation of the individual souls with the connection of ignorance and action, which have the quality of modification. From the destruction of that,

original: samupaśāntakāryabhedarūpe tasmin paramakāraṇātmani teṣāṃ vilayaḥ paraṃ śreya iti
analyzed: samupaśānta kārya bheda rūpe tasmin parama kāraṇa ātmani teṣām vilayaḥ param śreyaḥ iti
translated: in that supreme cause, which has the form of the cessation of the distinction of effects, their dissolution is the highest good.

original: keṣāñcid durabhyupagamaḥ / avyākṛtādiṣvityādigrahaṇāt prakṛtilayavādino'rvāktvato
analyzed: keṣāñcid durabhyupagamaḥ avyākṛta ādiṣu iti ādi grahaṇāt
translated: Some find it difficult to accept. The word ādi (etc.) in in the unmanifest and so on includes those who believe in dissolution into primordial matter and those who believe in dissolution into the past.

original: ye'vasthitāstvahaṅkārādilayavādinastauṣṭikāḥ / taduktam ādhyātmikyaścatasraḥ
analyzed: yeva sthitāḥ tu ahaṅkāra ādi laya vādinaḥ tauṣṭikāḥ tat uktam ādhyātmikyaḥ catasraḥ
translated: Those who believe in dissolution into ego and so on, who are satisfied, are mentioned. It is said: The four internal

original: prakṛtyupādānakālabhāgyākhyāḥ / bāhyā viṣayoparamāt pañca nava tuṣṭayo'bhihitāḥ //
analyzed: prakṛti upādāna kāla bhāgya ākhyāḥ bāhyāḥ viṣaya uparamāt pañca nava tuṣṭayaḥ abhihitāḥ
translated: are called primordial matter, material cause, time, and luck. The five external are mentioned as the nine satisfactions due to the cessation of objects.

original: iti // //
analyzed: sām kā iti
translated: Thus.

original: mahāgaṇo maheśasya tvakartā sarvavedyavit /
analyzed: mahā gaṇaḥ maheśasya tu akartā sarva vedya vid
translated: The great assembly of Mahesha, the non-creator, the knower of all objects,

original: kartṛtve'pi prayojyatvaṃ samatvaṃ tejasāṃnidheḥ // //
analyzed: kartṛ tve api prayojya tvam samatvam tejasāṃnidheḥ
translated: even in creation, is the employability of the abode of light.

original: phalāntaraṃ sālokyasāmīpyādiprāptiḥ / yaduktaṃ pauṣkare anyābhiriha
analyzed: phala antaram sālokya sāmīpya ādi prāptiḥ yat uktam pauṣkare anyābhiḥ iha
translated: The other fruit is the attainment of association, proximity, and so on. As it is said in the Pushkara:

original: dīkṣābhirnanirvāṇamavāpyate / gāṇapatyapadaṃ tābhiḥ iti / etadeva ca yogipadena sūtrakṛtā
analyzed: dīkṣābhiḥ na nirvāṇam avāpyate gāṇapatya padam tābhiḥ iti etat eva ca yogi padena sūtrakṛtā
translated: By these other initiations, liberation is not attained. By these, the state of Ganapati is attained. This alone is indicated by the author of the aphorisms

original: nirdiṣṭam / akartā sarvavedyaviditi darśanāntaraphalam / parameśvare tāvat karmakartṛtvaṃ
analyzed: nirdiṣṭam akartā sarva vedya vid iti darśana antara phalam parameśvare tāvat karma kartṛ tvam
translated: as the state of the yogi. The non-creator, the knower of all objects, is the fruit of the other view. In the Supreme Lord, the state of being the agent of action

original: tanukaraṇabhuvanādikāryānyathānupapattyā pratipāditam / etasminnavasthite'dhunā
analyzed: tanu karaṇa bhuvana ādi kārya anyathā anupapattyā pratipāditam
translated: is taught by the non-applicability of the effects such as the body, senses, and worlds in any other way. When this is established, now

original: muktapuruṣe kartṛtvasiddhau na kāryānyathānupapattirbhavati / atha īśvaravanmuktatvena
analyzed: muktapuruṣe kartṛ tva siddhau na kārya anyathā anupapattiḥ bhavati atha īśvara vat mukta tvena
translated: When the existence of an agent is established for a liberated person, there is no non-apprehension of an effect. If the establishment of agency is by liberation like God,

original: kartṛtvasiddhiḥ / tadayuktam / īśvarasya muktatvāsiddheradṛṣṭāntatvāt / baddho hi mucyata iti
analyzed: kartṛ tva siddhiḥ tat ayuktam īśvarasya mukta tva asiddheḥ adṛṣṭānta tvāt baddhaḥ hi mucyate iti
translated: that is not proper, because God is not established as liberated, and so cannot be an example. For one who is bound is liberated.

original: īśvarasiddhayoranenāṃśenātyantavaisādṛśyam / yathāha vyāsākṣiṇyāṃ tatrabhavāna
analyzed: īśvara siddhayoḥ anena aṃśena atyanta vaisādṛśyam yathā āha vyāsākṣiṇyām tatrabhavāna
translated: Thus there is complete dissimilarity between God and the liberated soul in this respect. As it is said in the Vyāsākṣipā, by that revered one:

original: vadhūtaḥ paramaśivaḥ siddhān pratyuparatādhikāro'pyanyeṣvanuparatādhikāraḥ / siddhaḥ
analyzed: vadhūtaḥ paramaśivaḥ siddhān pratyuparata adhikāraḥ api anyeṣu anuparata adhikāraḥ siddhaḥ
translated: The liberated soul, the supreme Śiva, though having ceased to have jurisdiction over the Siddhas, still has jurisdiction over others. The liberated soul

original: punarekāntena sarvat evoparatādhikāra iti bhedaḥ iti / na ca prāgapi puṃsaḥ kartṛtvamityāhuḥ /
analyzed: punar ekāntena sarvat eva uparata adhikāraḥ iti bhedaḥ iti na ca prāk api puṃsaḥ kartṛ tvam iti āhuḥ
translated: again has jurisdiction that has completely ceased in every way. This is the difference. And they say that the soul was not an agent even before.

original: kintu prakṛtereva tat sāṃkhyapakṣavaditi muktau kartṛtvasya pramāṇābhāvādakartṛtvameva /🔽jñānaṃ tu puṃsaḥ svābhāvikaṃ prāganubhavataḥ siddham / tattu muktāvāvaraṇābhāvena
analyzed: kintu prakṛteḥ eva tat sāṃkhya pakṣa vat iti muktau kartṛ tvasya pramāṇa abhāvāt akartṛ tvam eva  jñānam tu puṃsaḥ svābhāvikam prāk anubhavataḥ siddham tat tu muktau āvaraṇa abhāvena
translated: But that is the agency of Prakṛti, like in the Sāṃkhya view. Thus, due to the absence of any proof of agency in liberation, it is indeed non-agency.🔽But knowledge is naturally established for the soul even before experience. But that becomes all-pervading due to the absence of obscuration in liberation.

original: sarvaviṣayaṃ bhavatītyakartā sarvavedyavinmukta iti tadāgamavidaḥ / ta eva
analyzed: sarva viṣayam bhavati iti akartā sarva vedya vid muktaḥ iti tad āgama vidaḥ te eva
translated: Thus, those who know the scriptures say that the liberated soul is not an agent but knows all that is to be known.

original: hṛdayapramāṇādigranthakartṛtvenātra sūtrakṛtā pramāṇakartṛtvapadenopakṣiptāḥ /
analyzed: hṛdaya pramāṇa ādi grantha kartṛ tvena atra sūtrakṛtā pramāṇa kartṛ tva padena upakṣiptāḥ
translated: The author of the aphorisms has included them here under the word 'author of means of valid knowledge' as the author of works like the Hṛdaya.

original: kartṛtve'pi prayojyatvamityāgamāntaram / ayamarthaḥ jñātṛtvavat kartṛtvamapi puṃsaḥ
analyzed: kartṛ tve api prayojya tvam iti āgama antaram ayam arthaḥ jñātṛ tva vat kartṛ tvam api puṃsaḥ
translated: Even in authorship, the meaning of another scripture is that it is subordinate. This meaning is that the soul's authorship, like its knowledge,

original: svabhāva eva / na tu prakṛteḥ kartṛtvaṃ yuktam / kāraṇatvāt tasyāḥ / anyaddhi kāraṇatvaṃ🔽svarūpānyathābhāvarūpaṃ jaḍavastuṣu svabhāvatayaiva pariṇāmitvādyavyabhicāri kṣīra🔽dadhyādiṣvadhyakṣasiddham / anyacca kartṛtvaṃ hitāhitaprāptityāgaphalalipsayā
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ eva na tu prakṛteḥ kartṛ tvam yuktam kāraṇa tvāt tasyāḥ anyat hi kāraṇa tvam  svarūpa anyathābhāva rūpam jaḍa vastuṣu svabhāvatayā eva pariṇāmi tva ādi avyabhicāri kṣīra  dadhi ādiṣu adhyakṣa siddham anyat ca kartṛ tvam hita ahita prāpti tyāga phala lipsayā
translated: is indeed its very nature. But it is not proper that the Prakṛti should be the author, because it is the cause. For, the nature of being a cause

original: sarvānyakārakapravṛttinivṛttikāraṇatvena svātantryātmakaṃ śivatvāvyabhicāri
translated: is well known through perception in milk, curd, etc., where it is invariably concomitant with the transformation of one's own form. And the nature of being an author is the independence consisting in being the cause of the activity and cessation of all other agents, with the desire for the fruit of obtaining what is beneficial and avoiding what is not beneficial.

original: svasaṃvedanasiddhamiti vakṣyāmo mantravārttike / anumānenāpyātmanāṃ kartṛtvaṃ
analyzed: sva saṃvedana siddham iti vakṣyāmaḥ mantravārttike anumānena api ātmanām kartṛ tvam
translated: We will explain in the Mantravārtika that this is invariably concomitant with Śivahood, and is established by one's own experience. Even by inference, the authorship of the souls

original: sādhitameva tattvasaṃgrahādau vṛttikṛtā / nanu kartṛtve satyātmanāṃ spandātmakatvena
analyzed: sādhitam eva tattvasaṃgraha ādau vṛtti kṛtā nanu kartṛ tve sati ātmanām spanda ātmaka tvena
translated: has been established by the author of the commentary in the Tattvasaṅgraha, etc. But if the souls are authors, then by being of the nature of vibration,🔽they must be of the nature of action.

original: pariṇāmitā / na / kartṛtvasya spandātmakatvāsiddheḥ / kriyā hi spandaḥ /
analyzed: pariṇāmi tā na kartṛ tvasya spanda ātmaka tva asiddheḥ kriyā hi spandaḥ
translated: No, because the nature of being an agent is not established as being of the nature of vibration. For action is vibration.

original: na ca kriyārūpatvaṃ kartuḥ kartṛtvam / kartrantarakalpanāyāmanavasthāprasaṅgāt / api
analyzed: na ca kriyā rūpa tvam kartuḥ kartṛ tvam kartṛ antara kalpanāyām anavasthā prasaṅgāt api
translated: And the nature of being an agent is not the form of action. Because if another agent were postulated, there would be an infinite regress. But

original: tu tatra hetutayaiva / tatsāmarthyenaiva kāryakaraṇaspandadṛṣṭeriti /
analyzed: tu tatra hetu tayā eva tad sāmarthyena eva kārya karaṇa spanda dṛṣṭeḥ iti
translated: rather, there is only the cause there. Because the vibration of the body and organs is seen only by its power.

original: jaḍavyāpakakriyātmakaspandaḥ kathaṃ caitanyavyāpakatvāvyabhicāriṇi kartari bhavet / na ca🔽spandātmakataiva kārakatvam / api tu viśiṣṭaśaktiyogaḥ / ayaskāntādīnāmivetyukta
analyzed: jaḍa vyāpaka kriyā ātmaka spandaḥ katham caitanya vyāpaka tva avyabhicāriṇi kartari bhavet na ca  spanda ātmaka tā eva kāraka tvam api tu viśiṣṭa śakti yogaḥ ayaskānta ādīnām iva iti ukta
translated: And how can the vibration which is the action of the inert and pervasive be in the agent which is invariably pervasive of consciousness? And

original: masmābhiranyatra / jaḍaspandakriyāyāṃ yā śaktiḥ sā kartṛtā cito vyāpte spandarūpeṇa
analyzed: mā asmābhiḥ anyatra jaḍa spanda kriyāyām yā śaktiḥ sā kartṛ tā citaḥ vyāpte spanda rūpeṇa
translated: being of the nature of vibration is not itself being an agent, but rather the possession of a special power, like that of the magnet and so on. This has been said by us elsewhere. The power in the inert and vibrating action, which is the agency of consciousness pervading vibration,

original: siddhā'yaskāntavat svata iti / tacca kartṛtvaṃ teṣāmanādyeveśvaraprayojyatayā siddham /
analyzed: siddha ayaskānta vat svatas iti tat ca kartṛ tvam teṣām anādi eva īśvara prayojya tayā siddham
translated: is established by itself like the magnet. And that agency of theirs is established as being employed by the primordial Lord.

original: anādeśca vināśo na saṃbhavatīti muktāḥ śivāḥ sarvajñāḥ sarvakartāraḥ paramaśivena
analyzed: anādeḥ ca vināśaḥ na saṃbhavati iti muktāḥ śivāḥ sarva jñāḥ sarva kartāraḥ paramaśivena
translated: And the destruction of the beginningless is not possible. Therefore, the liberated Śivas are omniscient, all-powerful, and are employed only by the supreme Śiva.

original: prayojyā eveti tannītijñāḥ /
analyzed: prayojyāḥ eva iti tad nīti jñāḥ
translated: Those who know that rule.

original: samatvaṃ tejasāṃnidheriti darśanāntaraphalam / ādityāgnyādisamatā tattadāgameṣu
analyzed: sama tvam tejasāṃnidheḥ iti darśana antara phalam āditya agni ādi sama tā tad tad āgameṣu
translated: The result of another view is that the equality of the luminaries is due to the proximity of the sun. The equality with the sun, fire, etc. is heard in those scriptures

original: mahopaniṣadādiṣu śrūyate yataḥ / āgneyakartṛtvena caite sūtrakṛtā nirdiṣṭāḥ // //
analyzed: mahā upaniṣad ādiṣu śrūyate yatas āgneya kartṛ tvena ca ete sūtrakṛtā nirdiṣṭāḥ
translated: such as the great Upanishads, because they are indicated by the author of the sutras as having the sun as their agent.

original: ādhikyaṃ parameśānānnirmalatvaṃ ca kevalam /
analyzed: ādhikyam parameśānāt nirmala tvam ca kevalam
translated: The superiority is only due to the pure nature of the supreme Lord.

original: siddha eva hi kartṛtvamaudāsīnyaṃ maheśvare // //
analyzed: siddhe eva hi kartṛ tvam audāsīnyam maheśvare
translated: Only in the accomplished one is there agency, and neutrality in Mahesvara.

original: phalāntaram parameśasya layādhikārābhyupagamenādhikārādibandhayogataḥ
analyzed: phala antaram parameśasya laya adhikāra abhyupagamena adhikāra ādi bandha yogataḥ
translated: The other result is due to the bondage of authority, etc., by accepting the dissolution and authority of the supreme Lord,

original: paśutvasyānapāyāt / yadāhuḥ anugrahatirobhāvau dvau pāśau tu sadāśive iti /
analyzed: paśutvasya anapāyāt yat āhuḥ anugraha tirobhāvau dvau pāśau tu sadāśive iti
translated: because of the non-cessation of the state of being a bound soul, as they say: The two bonds of grace and concealment are always in Sadasiva,

original: paśūrādyaḥ sadāśivaḥ iti ca / vinivṛttasamastabandhanāt tiraskṛtalayādyavasthādhikārāt
analyzed: paśūḥ ādyaḥ sadāśivaḥ iti ca vinivṛtta samasta bandhanāt tiraskṛta laya ādi avasthā adhikārāt
translated: and Sadasiva is the first bound soul. And because of the cessation of all bonds, and the concealment of the state of dissolution, etc.,

original: sarvathaivānupādheḥ siddhātmanaḥ prakṛṣṭataro nyūnabhāva iti / anye tu pātañjalamuktirupa
analyzed: sarvathā eva anupādheḥ siddhātmanaḥ prakṛṣṭataraḥ nyūnabhāvaḥ iti anye tu pātañjala muktiḥ upa
translated: the nature of the accomplished self, which is without any limiting adjunct, is more excellent than the inferior state. But others say that the statement of Patanjali is

original: kṣipteti kathayanti / teṣāṃ pūrvameva kaivalyapadena sāṃkhyamuktivat sāpyupātteti
analyzed: kṣiptā iti kathayanti teṣām pūrvam eva kaivalya padena sāṃkhya mukti vat sā api upāttā iti
translated: superseded. For them, even before, by the word kaivalya (isolation), that [state] is also accepted like the liberation of the Sankhyas.

original: paunaruktyamanivāryam / na hi tayormuktau bhedaḥ / prakṛtiviyogarūpatvādubhayatrāpi tasyāḥ /
analyzed: paunaruktyam anivāryam na hi tayoḥ muktau bhedaḥ prakṛti viyoga rūpa tvāt ubhayatra api tasyāḥ
translated: Repetition is unavoidable. For there is no difference between the two in liberation. For that [liberation] is of the nature of separation from primordial materiality in both cases.

original: ata evāhūḥ ekaṃ sāṃkhyaṃ ca yogaṃ ca / iti / kintupāyabhedaḥ ekatra
analyzed: atas eva āhūḥ ekam sāṃkhyam ca yogam ca iti kintu pāya bhedaḥ ekatra
translated: For this very reason they say, Sāṃkhya and Yoga are one. But there is a difference in means.🔽For in one [Sāṃkhya], knowledge is the means, while in the other [Yoga], it is practice. Enough of this extensive [discussion]. And this very superiority is

original: hi jñānaṃ tadupāyaḥ / aparatra tvabhyāsa ityalaṃ vistareṇeti / etadeva cādhikyaṃ sūtrakṛtā
analyzed: hi jñānam tat upāyaḥ aparatra tu abhyāsaḥ iti alam vistareṇa iti etat eva ca ādhikyam sūtrakṛtā
translated: stated by the author of the aphorisms

original: maheśvarapadenoktam / nirmalatvaṃ ca kevalamiti malanivṛttimātrameva mokṣaḥ / na tu🔽sarvajñatvādyabhivyaktirapi / prāganabhivyaktatatsadbhāve pramāṇābhāvāt / sato
analyzed: sarvajñatva ādi abhivyaktiḥ api prāk anabhivyakta tad sadbhāve pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: with the word Maheśvara. And mere freedom from impurity means that liberation is merely the cessation of impurity. It is not

original: hyabhivyaktirityāśayaḥ / siddha eva hi kartṛtvamaudāsīnyaṃ maheśvara iti / yadāha sūtrakṛt
analyzed: hi abhivyaktiḥ iti āśayaḥ siddhe eva hi kartṛ tvam audāsīnyam maheśvare iti yat āha sūtrakṛt
translated: the manifestation of omniscience, etc. either. For there is no evidence that that [omniscience, etc.] exists prior to its manifestation. The idea is that the manifestation is of what exists. For the state of being a great lord is indeed established. As the author of the aphorisms says:

original: viśikhāmalakārakāḥ iti / parameśvaro hi pārārthyena jagatkaraṇāya pravṛttaḥ /
analyzed: viśikha āmala kārakāḥ iti parameśvaraḥ hi pārārthyena jagat karaṇāya pravṛttaḥ
translated: The arrows, the impurities, are the agents. For the supreme lord, engaged in creating the world for the sake of others,

original: sarvakartṛtvapadaprāptāvasthaṃ svātmatulyaṃ siddhamavalokya tatkālamevātmanaḥ kartṛtvaṃ
analyzed: sarvakartṛ tva pada prāpta avastham sva ātma tulyam siddham avalokya tad kālam eva ātmanaḥ kartṛ tvam
translated: seeing the established one equal to himself in the state of attaining the position of being the creator of all, at that very moment, his own agency

original: vibhinnamityanekakartṛsaṃbhavena samastakṛtyāniyamaprasaṅgadoṣataḥ pratyuta
analyzed: vibhinnam iti aneka kartṛ saṃbhavena samasta kṛtyā niyama prasaṅga doṣataḥ pratyuta
translated: Being different, due to the possibility of multiple agents, there is the fault of the contingency of the restriction of all actions. Rather,

original: parārthānirvāhakāraṇamevāvagamya tadupasaṃhṛtyodāsīnaḥ svātmanā bhavati / siddhaḥ
analyzed: parārtha a nirvāha kāraṇam eva avagamya tat upasaṃhṛtya udāsīnaḥ sva ātmanā bhavati siddhaḥ
translated: understanding that it is the very cause of the non-fulfillment of the purpose of others, having withdrawn that, he becomes indifferent with his own self. Being accomplished,

original: punaḥ parārthanirvāhamanāsthayeśvareṇoktamavabudhya sarvakartrā ca vinā
analyzed: punar parārtha nirvāham anāsthayā īśvareṇa uktam avabudhya sarvakartrā ca vinā
translated: again, understanding what is said by the Lord who is not dependent on the fulfillment of the purpose of others, and without

original: sarvaparārthasaṃpattimākalayya karuṇayaiva sarvakartṛtvapadamavalambata iti
analyzed: sarva parārtha saṃpattim ākalayya karuṇayā eva sarva kartṛ tva padam avalambate iti
translated: all-pervasiveness, having realized the attainment of all the purposes of others, he resorts to the state of being the agent of all by compassion alone.

original: pravāhanityeśvaravādinaḥ // //
analyzed: pravāha nitya īśvara vādinaḥ
translated: Thus, those who advocate the doctrine of the eternal Lord of the current.

original: satkāryakaraṇopetastārakābhuvane sthitaḥ /
analyzed: satkārya karaṇa upetaḥ tārakā bhuvane sthitaḥ
translated: Endowed with the effect and cause, residing in the world of stars,

original: jñānakartṛtvayornāśaḥ sarvanāśastathāparaḥ // //
analyzed: jñāna kartṛ tvayoḥ nāśaḥ sarva nāśaḥ tathā aparaḥ
translated: The destruction of knowledge and agency, and the destruction of all else.

original: anādireva puruṣaḥ kāryakaraṇaiḥ pravāhataḥ saṃsarati saṃbaddhaḥ /
analyzed: anādiḥ eva puruṣaḥ kārya karaṇaiḥ pravāhataḥ saṃsarati saṃbaddhaḥ
translated: The Purusha is beginningless itself. It transmigrates along with the effect and cause.

original: tatrānādervināśāyogena muktau kāryakaraṇābhāve pramāṇāsaṃbhavāt kevalaṃ
analyzed: tatra anādeḥ vināśa ayogena muktau kārya karaṇa abhāve pramāṇa asaṃbhavāt kevalam
translated: There, due to the impossibility of destruction of the beginningless, in liberation, in the absence of the effect and cause, there is no possibility of valid knowledge. Therefore,

original: saṃsāraparidṛṣṭakarmanibandhanaduḥkhaśarīrendriyanivṛttau
analyzed: saṃsāra paridṛṣṭa karma nibandhana duḥkha śarīra indriya nivṛttau
translated: only in the cessation of the body and senses bound by the unseen merit and demerit of worldly existence,

original: prakṛṣṭatarakāryakaraṇalābhatastārakābhuvane nakṣatramārge'vasthānamātmanāṃ mokṣa iti
analyzed: prakṛṣṭatara kārya karaṇa lābhataḥ tārakā bhuvane nakṣatra mārga iva sthānam ātmanām mokṣaḥ iti
translated: Some have the wrong idea that liberation is the state of the souls in the stellar sphere, the path of the stars, due to the gain of a more excellent body and organs.

original: keṣāñcid durabhisandhiḥ / jñānakartṛtvayornāśa iti / muktau buddherabhāvādi
analyzed: keṣāñcid durabhisandhiḥ jñāna kartṛ tvayoḥ nāśaḥ iti muktau buddheḥ abhāva ādi
translated: The destruction of knowledge and agency, when there is no consciousness etc. in liberation,

original: cchāprayatnayorabhāve kartṛtvanāśaḥ / buddhyādīnāṃnāmabhāvaśca
analyzed: cchā prayatnayoḥ abhāve kartṛ tva nāśaḥ buddhi ādīnām nāma bhāvaḥ ca
translated: the destruction of agency due to the absence of desire and effort, and the absence of intellect etc.,

original: navānāmātmaguṇānāṃnāmabhāvāt /🔽yadāhuḥ buddhisukhaduḥkhecchādveṣaprayatnasaṃskāradharmādharmāṇāṃ
analyzed: navānām ātma guṇānām nāma bhāvāt  yat āhuḥ buddhi sukha duḥkha icchā dveṣa prayatna saṃskāra dharma adharmāṇām
translated: due to the absence of the nine qualities of the self.🔽As they say: Final liberation is the complete freedom from the nine - intellect, pleasure, pain, desire, aversion, effort, impressions, virtue and vice.

original: navānāmatyantaṃ vimokṣo'pavargaḥ iti / sarvanāśastathāpara iti🔽grāhakaikarūpatvāccaitanyasya grāhakatvasya ca grāhyāpekṣayā'vastitergrāhyasya🔽cāṇusthūlādivikalpaiḥ sarvathā saṃbhavābhāvenāvasturūpatvāt tadapekṣasyāpi
analyzed: navānām atyantam vimokṣa upavargaḥ iti sarva nāśaḥ tathā aparaḥ iti  grāhaka eka rūpa tvāt caitanyasya grāhaka tvasya ca grāhya apekṣayā avastiteḥ grāhyasya  ca aṇu sthūla ādi vikalpaiḥ sarvathā saṃbhava abhāvena avastu rūpa tvāt tad apekṣasya api
translated: Another says it is the destruction of everything.🔽And because consciousness and the state of being an apprehender have the same form, and the state of being an apprehender is established in relation to the apprehended,🔽and the apprehended, due to the impossibility of any kind of existence in terms of the alternatives of being atomic, gross etc., is of the nature of non-existence,

original: grāhakatvasya bhrāntatve sati bādhajñānodayamātreṇaiva dhvaṃsa iti pradīpanīrvāṇavādina
analyzed: grāhaka tvasya bhrānta tve sati bādha jñāna udaya mātreṇa eva dhvaṃsaḥ iti pradīpa nīrvāṇa vādinaḥ
translated: even that state of being an apprehender, which depends on that, is false, and is destroyed merely by the arising of the knowledge of contradiction, just as the lamp is destroyed by the flame.

original: iti / anyaistu bhūtebhya eva vijñānamutpadyate / tānyevānuvinaśyatīti śarīravināśādeva
analyzed: iti anyaiḥ tu bhūtebhyaḥ eva vijñānam utpadyate tāni eva anuvinaśyati iti śarīra vināśāt eva
translated: Thus, others say that consciousness arises from the elements themselves and follows their destruction. Thus, with the destruction of the body,

original: sarvanāśa ityevamayaṃ pakṣo'bhyupagato jāḍyāditi // //
analyzed: sarva nāśaḥ iti evam ayam pakṣaḥ abhyupagataḥ jāḍyāt iti
translated: everything is destroyed. Thus, this view is accepted by them due to their dullness.

original: evaṃ ca tantrāntaraprasiddhaṃ phalaṃ pradarśyopasaṃharati
analyzed: evam ca tantra antara prasiddham phalam pradarśya upasaṃharati
translated: Having thus shown the result well-known in other scriptures, he concludes:

original: svamatairvādibhistvevaṃ vimuktiḥ parikalpitā /
analyzed: sva mataiḥ vādibhiḥ tu evam vimuktiḥ parikalpitā
translated: Thus, liberation is imagined by the proponents of their own views.

original: dṛṣṭā naiva hi mohāndhaiḥ sadīśvarasamānatā // //
analyzed: dṛṣṭā nā eva hi moha andhaiḥ sat īśvara samāna tā
translated: Indeed, it is not seen by the blind of delusion, the equality with the Lord.

original: taistairmohāndhairavidyākrāntacinnayanaiḥ satyabhūtaparameśvarasamatālakṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: taiḥ taiḥ moha andhaiḥ avidyā ākrānta cit nayanaiḥ satya bhūta parameśvara samatā lakṣaṇam
translated: By those blind with delusion, by those whose eyes of consciousness are seized by ignorance, the characteristic of liberation, which is the equality with the true Supreme Lord,

original: patiśāstraikagamyamuktilakṣaṇaṃ phalaṃ na dṛṣṭam / atastairevaṃ vidhā muktiḥ
analyzed: pati śāstra eka gamya mukti lakṣaṇam phalam na dṛṣṭam atas taiḥ evaṃvidhā muktiḥ
translated: which is known only through the scriptures on the Lord, the characteristic of liberation, the result, is not seen. Therefore, by them, such liberation

original: svakalpanābhiḥ kalpiteti // //
analyzed: sva kalpanābhiḥ kalpitā iti
translated: is imagined through their own imaginations.

original: idānīṃ samānatāntrikān pratyāha
analyzed: idānīm samāna tāntrikān pratyāha
translated: Now, he says to those who follow the Samatantra:

original: samatā ca samutpattisaṃkrāntyāveśapakṣataḥ /
analyzed: sama tā ca samutpatti saṃkrānti āveśa pakṣataḥ
translated: And equality is said to be supreme, through the aspects of origination, transference, and possession,

original: abhivyaktiḥ parā gītā buddhivācāmagocarā // //
analyzed: abhivyaktiḥ parā gītā buddhi vācām agocarā
translated: which is beyond the scope of intellect and speech.

original: sarvajñatvādiguṇābhivyaktirūpaparameśvarasamatā parā prakṛṣṭā gītā / kutaḥ
analyzed: sarvajña tva ādi guṇa abhivyakti rūpa parameśvara samatā parā prakṛṣṭā gītā kutas
translated: The supreme equality with the Supreme Lord, which is in the form of the manifestation of the qualities of omniscience and so on, is said to be excellent. Why?

original: paretyāha samutpattisaṃkrāntāveśapakṣata iti / paśvavasthāyāṃ
analyzed: parā iti āha samutpatti saṃkrānta āveśa pakṣataḥ iti paśu avasthāyām
translated: Having mentioned the doctrine of origination, transference, and possession, he says:

original: sarvajñatvādidharmāsattvānmuktau ca parameśvarasamatvaśrutyanyathānupapattyā
analyzed: sarvajña tva ādi dharma asattvāt muktau ca parameśvara samatva śruti anyathā anupapattyā
translated: Because omniscience and other attributes do not exist in the state of an animal, and because it is not otherwise possible to explain the scriptural statement of equality with the Supreme Lord in liberation,

original: paśvātmanyapūrva eva tadā sarvajñatvādiguṇaḥ parameśvarasama utpadyata
analyzed: paśu ātmani apūrve eva tadā sarvajña tva ādi guṇaḥ parameśvara samaḥ utpadyata
translated: some accept the doctrine of equality of origination, that the attribute of omniscience and others, which are equal to the Supreme Lord, are produced in the individual soul at that time, never having existed before.

original: ityutpattisamatāpakṣaḥ kaiścidabhyupagataḥ / tathā parairapi paṭādau kastūrikāmodavattatra
analyzed: iti utpatti samatā pakṣaḥ kaiścid abhyupagataḥ tathā paraiḥ api paṭa ādau kastūrikā āmoda vat tatra
translated: Similarly, others have accepted the doctrine of complete transference, that the attribute of the Supreme Lord, like the fragrance of musk in a cloth,

original: parameśvaraguṇaḥ saṃkrāmati muktāviti samastasaṃkrāntipakṣaḥ pratipannaḥ / etena
analyzed: parameśvara guṇaḥ saṃkrāmati muktau iti samasta saṃkrānti pakṣaḥ pratipannaḥ etena
translated: is transferred there in liberation. By this,

original: śikhāsaṃkrāntivādinaḥ pāśupatāḥ sūtrakṛtā viśikhākārakatvenoktāḥ / anyaistu tadā
analyzed: śikhā saṃkrānti vādinaḥ pāśupatāḥ sūtra kṛtā viśikhā kāraka tvena uktāḥ anyaiḥ tu tadā
translated: the Pasupatas, who propound the doctrine of the transference of the tuft, are mentioned by the author of the aphorisms as having the form of an arrow. But by others,

original: parameśvaraguṇaiḥ svāśrayasthaireva siddhaḥ samāviśyate grahairiva puruṣa ityāveśapakṣaḥ /
analyzed: parameśvara guṇaiḥ sva āśraya sthaiḥ eva siddhaḥ samāviśyate grahaiḥ iva puruṣaḥ iti āveśa pakṣaḥ
translated: the doctrine of possession is accepted, that the individual soul is possessed by the attributes of the Supreme Lord, which are established in their own substratum, like a person by planets.

original: etebhya īśvarasamatāpakṣāntarebhya iyamabhivyaktisamatā vakṣyamāṇā
analyzed: etebhyaḥ īśvarasamatā pakṣa antarebhyaḥ iyam abhivyakti samatā vakṣyamāṇā
translated: From among these alternative doctrines of equality with God, this doctrine of equality of manifestation, which will be stated,

original: buddhivācāmagocaratvāt parā // //
analyzed: buddhi vācām agocara tvāt parā
translated: is supreme because it is beyond the range of intellect and speech.

original: evaṃ tantrāntaraphalāni nirdiśyārthakrameṇa pratikṣipati
analyzed: evam tantra antara phalāni nirdiśya artha krameṇa pratikṣipati
translated: Having thus indicated the fruits of other systems, he rejects them in order of importance.

original: sattvabhuk tārakāvāsī dvayametad vinaśvaram /
analyzed: sattva bhuj tārakā vāsī dvayam etat vinaśvaram
translated: The enjoyer of beings and the dweller in the stars - both of these are perishable.

original: bhoktā bhuvanavāsī ca dṛṣṭo loke vinaśvaraḥ // //
analyzed: bhoktā bhuvana vāsī ca dṛṣṭaḥ loke vinaśvaraḥ
translated: The enjoyer and the dweller in the world are seen in the world to be perishable.

original: sattvabhuk tārakāvāsītyetaddvayamapi phalaṃ vinaśvaram / bhokturbhuvanavāsinaśca
analyzed: sattva bhuj tārakā vāsī iti etat dvayam api phalam vinaśvaram bhoktuḥ bhuvana vāsinaḥ ca
translated: The two fruits, the enjoyer of beings and the dweller in the stars, are also perishable. The destruction of the enjoyer and the dweller in the world

original: devadattādervināśo dṛṣṭaḥ / nanu bhoktṛtvaṃ jñātṛtvameva puruṣasvabhāvo'trākarmaphalaṃ
analyzed: devadatta ādeḥ vināśaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ nanu bhoktṛ tvam jñātṛ tvam eva
translated: is seen in the case of Devadatta and others. But isn't being an enjoyer just the nature of a person, the knower, not the result of action?

original: kathaṃ vinaśyatītyuktam / yadyevaṃ sarvajña eva tadā puruṣo bhavet / na sattvamātrajñaḥ /
analyzed: katham vinaśyati iti uktam yadi evam sarvajñaḥ eva tadā puruṣaḥ bhavet na sattva mātra jñaḥ
translated: How is it said to be perishable? If so, then the person would be omniscient at that time, not just a knower of beings.

original: viśeṣahetvābhāvādityasmaddarśanameva bhavatu / nanvastvevam / bhuvanavāsinastu
analyzed: viśeṣa hetu ābhāvāt iti asmad darśanam eva bhavatu nanu astu evam bhuvana vāsinaḥ tu
translated: Because there is no specific reason, let our own view be. But isn't it so? The connection of the dweller in the world

original: pravāhānādibhirbhuvanādibhiḥ saṃbandhaḥ kathaṃ nivartate / ata eva pravāhānāditvāt
analyzed: pravāha anādibhiḥ bhuvana ādibhiḥ saṃbandhaḥ katham nivartate atas eva pravāha anādi tvāt
translated: with the world and so on, which are beginningless and continuous, how can it cease? For this very reason, because they are beginningless and continuous,

original: karmabhistattatphalairvā dūṭasthanityasvabhāvo'nivartya iti paramārthaḥ // //
analyzed: karmabhiḥ tad tad phalaiḥ vā paramārthaḥ
translated: the eternally abiding nature of the messenger is not reversible by actions or their fruits. This is the ultimate truth.

original: gaṇendrāgnisamau preryāvasampūrṇamanorathau /
analyzed: gaṇa indra agni samau preryau a sampūrṇa manorathau
translated: Having urged the two leaders, Agni and Indra, whose desires are not fully fulfilled,

original: akartā cākṛtārtho hi tadvanneśe samo yataḥ // //
analyzed: akartā ca akṛtārthaḥ hi tadvat na īśe samaḥ yatas
translated: And the non-agent and the one whose purpose is not accomplished, in the same way, because of equality with the Lord.

original: atra mahāgaṇo maheśasya / samatvaṃ tejasāṃnidheḥ ityetayoḥ pakṣayoḥ
analyzed: atra mahā gaṇaḥ maheśasya sama tvam tejasāṃnidheḥ iti etayoḥ pakṣayoḥ
translated: Here, in the two positions of the great multitude and equality with Maheśa, the abode of radiance,

original: parākṛtiḥ / gaṇendrasamasya tāvaduparitanapadasadbhāvenaiva
analyzed: parākṛtiḥ gaṇendra samasya tāvat uparitana pada sadbhāvena eva
translated: there is a superimposition. As long as there is the existence of a higher position for the leader of the multitude,

original: tatprāptikāmanāntarayogato'saṃpūrṇamanorathateti kathaṃ muktiḥ / evamagnyādityasamatvayorapi
analyzed: tad prāpti kāmanā antara yogataḥ saṃpūrṇa manoratha tā iti katham muktiḥ evam agni āditya sama tvayoḥ api
translated: how can there be liberation due to the incompleteness of desire, due to the connection with the desire for its attainment? In the same way, it should be seen in the case of equality with fire and the sun also.

original: draṣṭavyam / athāsmadādyapratyakṣo'nya eva sarvajñaḥ sarvakartā ca vahnyādityādirucyate /
analyzed: draṣṭavyam atha asmat ādi apratyakṣaḥ nyaḥ eva sarvajñaḥ sarva kartā ca vahnyāt ityādiḥ ucyate
translated: Now, if it is said that fire, the sun, etc. are something else, imperceptible to us, omniscient and all-creating,

original: yadyevaṃ tatsamatvaṃ muktirityasmaddarśanamevetyadoṣaḥ / akartā cetyanena akartā
analyzed: yadi evam tad samatvam muktiḥ iti asmad darśanam eva iti adoṣaḥ akartā ca iti anena akartā
translated: if so, then liberation is equality with that, so it is our own view, thus there is no fault. By and the non-agent, the positions of the non-agent

original: sarvavedyavit / kartṛtve'pi prayojyatvam ityetau pakṣāvapodyete / tadvaditi / yadvad
analyzed: sarva vedya vid kartṛ tve pi prayojya tvam iti etau pakṣau apodyete tadvat iti yadvat
translated: knowing all that is to be known and even when acting, being directed are rejected. In the same way means

original: gaṇendrāgnisamāvaparipūrṇamanorathāvuktau / tadvadetāvapi
analyzed: gaṇa indra agni samau aparipūrṇa manorathau uktau tadvat etau api
translated: just as the leader of the multitude and the one equal to fire are said to have incomplete desires, in the same way these two also,🔽due to the connection with the desire for the attainment of the position of being created by the Supreme Lord, have incomplete desires,

original: parameśvarasamakartṛkatvapadāprāptihetostadabhilāṣayogādaparipūrṇamanorathatvāt
analyzed: parameśvara sama kartṛka tva pada aprāpti hetoḥ tad abhilāṣa yogāt aparipūrṇa manoratha tvāt
translated: because of the cause of not attaining the position of being created by the Supreme Lord.

original: sarvajñāvapyamuktau / svarūpāvaptireva hi mokṣaḥ / kartṛtvamapi jñātṛtvavat puṃsaḥ
analyzed: sarvajñau api amuktau svarūpa avaptiḥ eva hi mokṣaḥ kartṛ tvam api jñātṛ tva vat puṃsaḥ
translated: Even if omniscient, they are not liberated. For liberation is the attainment of one's own nature. And it has been said that agency is also the innate nature of the soul, like knowledge.

original: svabhāva evetyuktam / atastadanavāptau kathaṃ muktiḥ / astvevam /
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ evā iti uktam atas tad anavāptau katham muktiḥ astu evam
translated: Therefore, how can there be liberation if that is not attained? Let it be so.

original: mantreśvaraprayojyatvamanādyātmanāṃ kathaṃ kadā vyāvartate bandhanimittatvāt kalādivaditi
analyzed: mantreśvara prayojya tvam anādyātmanām katham kadā vyāvartate bandha nimitta tvāt kalā ādi vat iti
translated: How can the state of being employed by the Mantramaheśvara gods be averted for the beginningless souls? Because it is the cause of bondage, like the principles like kalā etc.

original: tadanivṛttestvasāvapi vidyeśvaravat preryatvādamukta eveti // //
analyzed: tad anivṛtteḥ tu asau api vidyeśvara vat prerya tvāt amuktaḥ evā iti
translated: Therefore, because that is not removed, he too, like the Vidyā-Īśvara gods, is not liberated because he is still to be impelled.

original: ādhikyaṃ parameśānāt iti pakṣamābhāsayati
analyzed: ādhikyam parameśānāt iti pakṣam ābhāsayati
translated: He presents the view that there is superiority over the Supreme Lord:

original: ādhikye sādhanāsattvamasaṃsthā ca dvimārgataḥ /🔽praryatvaṃ parameśāne nir /nimittamathā''patet // //🔽sādhanāsattvaṃ pramāṇābhāvaḥ / nahi sarvajñatvasarvakartṛtva🔽rūpanirmalaprakṛṣṭatarasvaguṇavyaktipratilambhataḥ kadācidātmanāmadhikāvasthā
analyzed: ādhikye sādhana asattvam asaṃsthā ca dvi mārgataḥ  parameśāne nirnimittam atha āpatet  sādhana asattvam pramāṇa abhāvaḥ nahi  rūpa nirmala prakṛṣṭatara sva guṇa vyakti pratilambhataḥ kadācid ātmanām adhikā avasthā
translated: If there is superiority, there is absence of means, and non-establishment from both paths.🔽If being impelled by the Supreme Lord were without cause, it would follow that

original: pramāṇairūpapadyate / yatprāptāvīśvarādhikyaṃ muktau varṇyate / nanūktamīśvarasya
analyzed: pramāṇaiḥ ūpapadyate yat prāptau īśvara ādhikyam muktau varṇyate nanu uktam īśvarasya
translated: Absence of means is the absence of valid means of knowledge. For the attainment of the state of superiority of the souls, which is the attainment of the manifestation of their own pure and excellent qualities in the form of omniscience and omnipotence, is not at any time established by valid means of knowledge. The superiority of the Lord over whom is attained is described as occurring in liberation. But it has been said that the Lord is

original: layādyavasthāsamāveśena siddhaṃ nyūnatvamiti / atha ko'yamavasthāsamāveśaḥ / yadi🔽vastvantaram / tanneṣyate / ekatvād devatāyāḥ / katham / dharmapariṇatisthāpyācaitanyadoṣeṇa
analyzed: laya ādi avasthā samāveśena siddham nyūna tvam iti atha kaḥ ayam avasthā samāveśaḥ yadi  vastu antaram tat na iṣyate ekatvāt devatāyāḥ katham dharma pariṇati sthāpya ācaitanya doṣeṇa
translated: The deficiency is established by the inclusion of the states such as dissolution, etc. Now, what is this inclusion of states? If🔽it is a different entity, that is not accepted, because the deity is one. How? The transformation of attributes, which is to be established, is previously prohibited and will be prohibited again due to the fault of insentience.

original: pūrvaṃ niṣiddhā niṣetsyate ca / atha vivartaḥ / so'pi na / asatyatvāt / tadrūpatāsya kutaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvam niṣiddhā niṣetsyate ca atha vivartaḥ saḥ api na asatya tvāt tad rūpa tā asya kutas
translated: Or if it is a manifestation, that is also not so, because it is unreal. How can it have that form?

original: kevalaṃ kriyāśaktiḥ kartaryavyatirekeṇa kartaryavāvasthitā śivapadaṃ samuddīpayantī
analyzed: kevalam kriyāśaktiḥ kartari a vyatirekeṇa kartari avasthitā śiva padam samuddīpayantī
translated: It is only the power of action, which, without being separate from the agent, abides in the agent, illuminating the state of Śiva,

original: layādipadavācyatvopādhibhāvaṃ tatra pratipadyate / saiva yadā🔽kāryasaṃpādanapravṛttā'navāpta kāryavikṛtistadā sadāśivapadaprakāśikā
analyzed: laya ādi pada vācya tva upādhi bhāvam tatra pratipadyate sā eva yadā  kārya saṃpādana pravṛttā anavāpta kārya vikṛtiḥ tadā sadāśiva pada prakāśikā
translated: and attains the condition of being the limiting adjunct for being denoted by the words such as dissolution, etc. That same power, when🔽engaged in accomplishing its effects, and not having attained its effective transformation, then it becomes the cause for being denoted by the words such as enjoyment, etc., which illuminates the state of Sadāśiva.

original: bhogādiśabdavācyatāyāṃ kāraṇībhavati / yadā khalvavāptakāryagrāmā
analyzed: bhoga ādi śabda vācya tāyām kāraṇībhavati yadā khalu avāpta kārya grāmā
translated: When, on the other hand, it has attained the entire group of effects,

original: adhikārapadaprabodhkā / tadeśvarādipadapravṛttau hetutāṃ bhajatīti kriyāśaktereva
analyzed: adhikāra pada prabodhkā tadā īśvara ādi pada pravṛttau hetutām bhajati iti kriyāśakteḥ eva
translated: it becomes the cause for the manifestation of the state of office, and for the engagement in the states of Īśvara, etc. Thus, the power of action

original: tattatkāryopādhibhedālambanamātreṇaivātra bhedavyavahāraḥ / na vastubhedaḥ /
analyzed: tad tad kārya upādhi bheda ālambana mātreṇa eva atra bheda vyavahāraḥ na vastu bhedaḥ
translated: itself, merely by taking as its support the difference of limiting adjuncts for each of those effects, engages in the usage of difference, not in the difference of entities.

original: vivartapariṇāmapakṣayoratyantāsaṃbhavāditi guravaḥ sacchāstravivekanipuṇāḥ / yadāhuḥ
analyzed: vivarta pariṇāma pakṣayoḥ atyanta asaṃbhavāt iti guravaḥ sat śāstra viveka nipuṇāḥ yat āhuḥ
translated: The teachers, skilled in the discrimination of true scriptures, say that the views of manifestation and transformation are absolutely impossible. As they say:

original: mūrtistadvāṃśceti hi leśāduktiśca śaktiśaktimatoḥ / ata eva
analyzed: mūrtiḥ tadvān ca iti hi leśāt uktiḥ ca śakti śaktimatoḥ atas eva
translated: The mention of form and its possessor is only partially, and the power and its possessor are mentioned. For this very reason,

original: pañcasrotaso'pyasya śāstrasyaikatvānna devatāyā bhedaḥ / api tu
analyzed: pañca srotasā upi asya śāstrasya eka tvāt na devatāyāḥ bhedaḥ api tu
translated: even in the five-current (five streams) of this scripture, there is no difference in the deity, but rather

analyzed: sṛṣṭi sthiti ādi pañcakṛtya bhedena upāsyamānasya tad ākāra mātrasya eva anyathā
translated: of the form of that which is to be worshipped by the difference of the five acts such as creation, sustenance, etc. Otherwise,

analyzed: kaula mahāvrata ādeḥ iva atra śāstra bheda prasaṅgāt ekatva śrutibhiḥ virodhaḥ evam ca siddhasya
translated: like the Kaula Mahāvratas, there would be the consequence of difference in the scripture here, and contradiction with the statements of oneness. And thus,

analyzed: prokta laya ādi avasthāna abhyupagame kartṛ tva adṛṣṭeḥ pratyuta īśvarāt nyūnatvam abhihitam
translated: if the established (Śiva) is accepted to be in the states mentioned such as dissolution, etc., then due to the non-perception of agency, it would be said that he is inferior to Īśvara,

original: syānnādhikyam /
analyzed: syāt na ādhikyam
translated: not superior.

original: atheśvarasyāpi yatparameśvaratvaṃ nirupādhijyotīrūpā sarvajñatvādiśaktiḥ yadāhuḥ
analyzed: atha īśvarasya api yat parameśvara tvam nirupādhi jyotīrūpā sarvajñatva ādi śaktiḥ yat āhuḥ
translated: Now, if Īśvara also has the state of the Supreme Lord, which is the power of omniscience etc. in the form of unconditioned light, as they say:

original: yayā vinā na sarvajñaḥ so'pi tasyai namo'stu te iti / tatprakṛṣṭataraṃ parameśvarasthānāt
analyzed: yayā vinā na sarvajñaḥ saḥ api tasyai namaḥ astu te iti tat prakṛṣṭataram parameśvara sthānāt
translated: Without which he is not omniscient, salutations to that power of his, that is more excellent than the state of the Supreme Lord.

original: siddhaprāpyamabhyupagamyata iti / tadayuktam / śaktiśaktimatorbhedāsiddhervyapadeśasya🔽bhedasya kalpitatvāt / sarvajñatvādiśakteriveśvaratvasyāpi tadrūpatvānnānyonyatā
analyzed: siddha prāpyam abhyupagamyate iti tat ayuktam śakti śaktimatoḥ bheda asiddheḥ vyapadeśasya  bhedasya kalpita tvāt sarvajñatva ādi śakteḥ iva īśvara tvasya api tad rūpa tvāt na anyonyatā
translated: It is accepted that it is attainable by the accomplished. That is not correct. Because the difference between power and the possessor of power is not established, and the designation🔽is superimposed. Because of the nature of the difference,

original: yuktetyabhinnasvabhāvaḥ śābdastu bhedo na bādhyate / tena ca tato'rthasthitiḥ / śakterapi
analyzed: yuktā iti abhinna svabhāvaḥ śābdaḥ tu bhedaḥ na bādhyate tena ca tatas ṛtha sthitiḥ śakteḥ api
translated: it is not proper to be mutually different. Therefore, the verbal difference of the undifferentiated nature is not negated. And by that, the establishment of the meaning is from that. Even of the power,

original: yacchaktatvaṃ tasyāpi yaḥ prakarṣaḥ / tasyāpi prakṛṣṭatarāvasthā muktirityevaṃ
analyzed: yat śakta tvam tasya api yaḥ prakarṣaḥ tasya api prakṛṣṭatara avasthā muktiḥ iti evam
translated: that which is powerful, of that also, that which is excellence, of that also, the state of excellence is liberation. Thus

original: taratamādipratipādyaprakarṣabhedāvyavasthiteranavasthitireva muktau bhavet /
analyzed: taratama ādi pratipādya prakarṣa bheda avyavasthiteḥ anavasthitiḥ eva muktau bhavet
translated: in liberation, there would be only instability due to the lack of establishment of the difference of excellence to be taught by the better, the middling, and the rest.

original: kalpitavyapadeśamātrabhedasya na kacidapyaprasṛtiḥ / tasmādīśvarasamataiva🔽muktāvabhyupagantavyā / na tvādhikyam / anugrahatirobhāvakartṛtvaṃ kartṛtvaviśeṣātmakatvānna
analyzed: kalpita vyapadeśa mātra bhedasya na kacid api aprasṛtiḥ tasmāt īśvara samatā eva  muktau abhyupagantavyāḥ na tu ādhikyam anugraha tirobhāva kartṛ tvam kartṛ tva viśeṣa ātmaka tvāt na
translated: The difference of the mere superimposed designation is not applicable anywhere. Therefore, the equality with God🔽should be accepted in liberation, and not superiority. The state of being the agent of grace and disappearance is not

original: pāśātmakam / anaupādhikatvāt / yadapi paśutvamuktaṃ bhavatā /
analyzed: pāśa ātmakam an aupādhika tvāt yat api paśu tvam uktam bhavatā
translated: the nature of bondage due to being the nature of a particular agent, because it is not adventitious. Even the state of being a bound soul that you have stated,

original: tadābhimānikabhedakalpanayā śaktyantaraprakāśapratipādanaphalaṃ yogapīṭhasaṃsthitāyeti
analyzed: tadā ābhimānika bheda kalpanayā śakti antara prakāśa pratipādana phalam yogapīṭha saṃsthitāya iti
translated: Then, by the conception of the difference based on that, the fruit of teaching the manifestation of another power is seated in the yoga seat.

original: mantrabhāṣyapratipāditabhagavatsadāśivapīṭhabhāvavat sakalaśāstraparyālocanayopacāradṛśā
analyzed: mantra bhāṣya pratipādita bhagavat sadāśiva pīṭha bhāva vat sakala śāstra paryālocanayā upacāra dṛśā
translated: Like the nature of the abode of Sadasiva, the Lord, taught by the mantra and commentary, it should be explained by the method of considering all the scriptures,

original: vyākhyeyam / na tu padamātrārthapratipattau graho balavadvidheyaḥ / ityalamanupāsitagurubhiḥ
analyzed: vyākhyeyam na tu pada mātra artha pratipattau grahaḥ balavat vidheyaḥ iti alam anupāsita gurubhiḥ
translated: but not when grasping the meaning of the words alone, should it be taken as the strong injunction. Thus, let there be an end to arguing with those who have not served the guru,

original: svakalpanotthāpitaśāstrārthaśālibhiḥ saha vivādena /
analyzed: sva kalpanā utthāpita śāstra artha śālibhiḥ saha vivādena
translated: who are full of the meaning of the scriptures they have imagined themselves.

original: yadvā paśurādyaḥ sadāśiva iti saṃskāryasadāśivābhiprāyeṇānupacārata eva /
analyzed: yat vā paśuḥ ādyaḥ sadāśivaḥ iti saṃskārya sadāśiva abhiprāyeṇa anupacārataḥ eva
translated: Or, the animal is the first Sadasiva, with the intention of the purified Sadasiva, not by figurative speech.

original: tathā hi dīkṣāyāṃ vidyātattvāduddhṛtasya krameṇa malakṣapaṇapūrvaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi dīkṣāyām vidyā tattvāt uddhṛtasya krameṇa mala kṣapaṇa pūrvam
translated: Thus, in initiation, after removing the impurity of what is extracted from the principle of knowledge in order,

original: kriyāśaktyātmaśivatvābhivyaktiḥ sthūlasūkṣmaparabhedena
translated: the manifestation of the nature of Siva, which is the power of action, is performed with the gross, subtle, and supreme distinctions,

original: kriyamāṇā'nekavidyeśvarāvasthāsvarūpābhivyaktirvastuto bhinnā
analyzed: kriyamāṇa aneka vidyeśvara avasthā svarūpa abhivyaktiḥ vastutas bhinnā
translated: the manifestation of the nature of the many states of Vidyesa is really different.

original: bhinnasyeśvarasadāśivaśivarūpasya tattvatrayasya prāptiheturbhavatīti tasmin sadāśive
analyzed: bhinnasya īśvara sadāśiva śiva rūpasya tattva trayasya prāpti hetuḥ bhavati iti tasmin sadāśive
translated: The cause of attaining the three principles of Isvara, Sadasiva, and Siva, which are different, becomes that Sadasiva.

original: preryatvānivṛtteḥ saṃskāramātraviśeṣatvena malasadbhāvāt paśutvamavyāvṛttamevetya
analyzed: prerya tva anivṛtteḥ saṃskāra mātra viśeṣa tvena mala sadbhāvāt paśutvam avyāvṛttam eva itya
translated: Because the state of being impelled is not removed, due to the mere difference in impressions, the existence of impurity, the state of being a bound soul is not averted.

original: nupacārāt paśuśabdapravṛtteriti / etacca vakṣyati vṛttikāraḥdīkṣayānte hi kva
analyzed: n upacārāt paśu śabda pravṛtteḥ iti etat ca vakṣyati vṛtti kāraḥ dīkṣayā ante hi kva
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of figurative usage, the word bound soul is used. And this will be stated by the commentator, beginning with Where can it exist at the end of initiation?

original: saṃbhavantītyādinā / saṃskārake tu sādāśive paramārthataḥ śivād bhedāsaṃbhavena
analyzed: saṃbhavanti ityādinā saṃskārake tu sādāśive paramārthataḥ śivāt bheda asaṃbhavena
translated: But in the sanctifying Sadāśiva, due to the impossibility of difference from Śiva in reality,

analyzed: tathātvam iti upacāraḥ proktaḥ doṣa antaram api asmin pakṣe iti āha asaṃsthā ca dvi mārgata
translated: that is stated to be figurative. And he says that there is another fault in this view, And there is no end with the two paths.

original: iti / mārgadvayenātrānavasthāprasaṅgaśca / tatraikena mārgeṇāhapraryatvamiti / atha tāvat🔽parameśvarasya kāraṇaṃ vinaiva siddhapreryatvaṃ parameśvaratva māpatatīti siddhasyaiva🔽tadādhikyena tadā parameśvaratvāt / anyathā tadādhikyābhidhānaṃ niṣphalameva siddhasya
analyzed: iti mārga dvayena atra anavasthā prasaṅgaḥ ca tatra ekena atha tāvat  parameśvarasya kāraṇam vinā eva siddha prerya tvam parameśvara tva mā āpatati iti siddhasya eva  tad ādhikyena tadā parameśvara tvāt anyathā tad ādhikya abhidhānam niṣphalam eva siddhasya
translated: And there is the undesirable consequence of infinite regress with the two paths. There, with one path, it is said that the state of being impelled is by another path. Now,🔽the state of being impelled without a cause is not possible for the Supreme Lord. Therefore, the state of being impelled is established.🔽Otherwise, the statement of superiority at that time would be fruitless for the established.

original: syāt / yatastasyāpi ca siddheśvarasya siddhāntaraprāptāvanīśvaratā / tasya
analyzed: syāt yatas tasya api ca siddheśvarasya siddha antara prāptau anīśvara tā tasya
translated: Because even for that established Lord, there is no lordship in attaining another established state. That

analyzed: tasya api iti evam anavasthitiḥ parameśvarasya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there would be an infinite regress of the Supreme Lord.

original: dvitīyena mārgeṇāha
analyzed: dvitīyena mārgeṇa āha
translated: By the second path, he says:

translated: And this imagination of a cause for the embodied beings would be useless.

analyzed: vaimalya mātreṇa paśuḥ na patiḥ kim asau bhavet  / yā iyam mumukṣūṇām bhavinām īśvarā ham syām iti nimitta tve
translated: If it were merely purity, would he not be a lord, but a mere animal?

analyzed: na īśvara tvena ātmanaḥ parikalpanā saṅkalpaḥ phala paryantaḥ sā vyarthā vigata prayojanā
translated: This imagination of the self as a lord, not as a cause, in the resolve of those who seek liberation, I would be a lord, up to the attainment of the fruit, would be useless, devoid of purpose,

analyzed: kevalam iti pakṣam dūṣayati vaimalya mātreṇa iti paśoḥ kiñcid jña tvāt patyuḥ ca

analyzed: sarvajña tvāt ubhaya vivekena nirmalasya nirmala tvena ananubhūta jñāna śakti tayā ca abhyupagamāt
translated: omniscience, and since the pure one is accepted as being distinguished from both by the power of knowledge not experienced due to the purity of knowledge,

analyzed: kim asau apuruṣa artha rūpaḥ mokṣaḥ pāṣāṇa prakhyaḥ na kiñcid ayam āśayaḥ
translated: would this liberation, which is not a human goal, be like a stone, nothing at all? This is the intention:

original: vakṣyamāṇavajjñātṛsvabhāvatvādevātmanastadanabhyupagame tannāśadoṣa eva / yadvakṣyati
analyzed: vakṣyamāṇa vat jñātṛ svabhāva tvāt eva ātmanaḥ tad anabhyupagame tad nāśa doṣaḥ eva yat vakṣyati
translated: If the Self is not accepted to be of the nature of the knower, as will be stated, then the fault of its destruction would follow. As it will be said:

original: mūḍhānāṃ jyeṣṭhamallāste yeṣāṃ svātmā vinaśyati iti // //
analyzed: mūḍhānām jyeṣṭha mallāḥ te yeṣām svātmā vinaśyati iti
translated: Those who are deluded, they are the greatest of fools, for whom the Self is destroyed.

translated: Why should God, who is without an agent, be afraid of the multitude of causes?

original: bahūnāṃ yugapanmukterdurnivārā sthitaiva sā // //
analyzed: bahūnām yugapad mukteḥ durnivārā sthitā eva sā
translated: The established state is indeed difficult to refute due to the simultaneous liberation of many.

original: kārakatvaṃ hi prāk siddhād bhagavato'bhūt / tatkimiti kena kāraṇena
analyzed: kāraka tvam hi prāk siddhāt bhagavataḥ bhūt tat kim iti kena kāraṇena
translated: The state of being an agent was for the Lord who was already established. For what reason

original: puruṣāntarasiddhau neṣyate / pūrvapakṣavādī kāraṇamāha kāraṇānīkabhītita iti /
analyzed: puruṣa antara siddhau na iṣyate pūrvapakṣa vādī kāraṇam āha kāraṇa anīka bhītitaḥ iti
translated: is the establishment of another person not accepted? The proponent of the prima facie view states the reason: because of fear of the multitude of causes.

original: kāraṇānāmanīkaḥ samūho'nekatvam / tasmādbhayaṃ tataḥ / tathāhi siddhasya tāvat
analyzed: kāraṇānām anīkaḥ samūhaḥ anekatvam tasmāt bhayam tatas tathā hi siddhasya tāvat
translated: The multitude of causes is the collection of many. Fear arises from that. Thus, for one who is already established,

original: tadānīṃ labdhacaritārthasarvakartṛtvato yadā kartṛtvaṃ parameśvarasyāpi tadā kartṛtvaṃ
analyzed: tadānīm labdha caritārtha sarva kartṛ tvataḥ yadā kartṛ tvam parameśvarasya api tadā kartṛ tvam
translated: at that time, when the state of being an agent of the Supreme Lord is also obtained, having accomplished all actions, then the state of being an agent🔽is different. With the possibility of many agents, let this be new, let this be ancient, in the creation of the world and so on, there is a calamity

original: vibhinnamityanekakartṛsaṃbhavena navamidamastu purāṇamidamastviti sarganirmāṇādau vaiśasaṃ
analyzed: vibhinnam iti aneka kartṛ saṃbhavena navam idam astu purāṇam idam astu iti sarga nirmāṇa ādau vaiśasam
translated: of destruction.

original: syāt / tadbhītenaṣyate / etatsiddhāntavādyāha bahūnāmiti / acintyatvāt kāraṇasāmarthyasya
analyzed: syāt tat bhītena aṣyate  etat siddhānta vādī āha bahūnām iti acintya tvāt kāraṇa sāmarthyasya
translated: It may be so. But that is refuted by the fear of that. The proponent of the established view says: Because of the inconceivability of the power of the cause,

original: yadā yugapad bahavo mucyante puruṣāḥ / tadā teṣāṃ pratyekaṃ caritārthasarvakartṛtvayogena
analyzed: yadā yugapad bahavaḥ mucyante puruṣāḥ tadā teṣām pratyekam caritārtha sarva kartṛ tva yogena
translated: when many men are liberated simultaneously, then for each of them, due to the fitness of having fulfilled their purpose,

original: tulyatayā kartṛtvādavikalpaḥ syāt / anyataravyavasthāyāścāsaṃbhavāt samuccayena kartṛtve
analyzed: tulya tayā kartṛ tvāt avikalpaḥ syāt anyatara vyavasthāyāḥ ca asaṃbhavāt samuccayena kartṛ tve
translated: there would be non-optionality due to equality of agency. And because the establishment of one or the other is impossible, in the combination of agencies,

original: sthitaiva sā sarganirmāṇādivaiśasyadāyikā / kāraṇānekatvato bhītiḥ / athāyaṃ vādī🔽lobharāgādikāraṇatvāt puṃsāṃ matyanyathābhāvasya tanniścitya muktau rāgādyabhāvenā
analyzed: sthitā eva sā sarga nirmāṇa ādi vaiśasya dāyikā kāraṇa aneka tvataḥ bhītiḥ atha ayam vādī  lobha rāga ādi kāraṇa tvāt puṃsām mati anyathābhāvasya tat niścitya muktau rāga ādi abhāvena
translated: that very [non-optionality] remains, giving rise to the diversity of creation, manifestation, etc. The fear is from the multiplicity of causes. Now this proponent

original: nekasiddhiyogenāpi matyanyathābhāvena sarganirmāṇādivaiśasaṃ parihariṣyati /
analyzed: neka siddhi yogena api mati anyathābhāvena sarga nirmāṇa ādi vaiśasam parihariṣyati
translated: will avoid the diversity of creation, manifestation, etc. by the transformation of the mind due to the non-existence of passion, etc. in liberation, which is ascertained by the causality of greed, passion, etc. of men, even with the fitness of many accomplishments.

original: tadasmanmatameva pratyavekṣyatītyāśayaśeṣaḥ // //
analyzed: tat asmad matam eva pratyavekṣyati iti āśaya śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder of the intention is that he will only examine our view.

original: idānīṃ samānatāntrikaphalāni dūṣayati
analyzed: idānīm samāna tāntrika phalāni dūṣayati
translated: Now he criticizes the results of the Sāṃkhya system

original: athotpattāvanityatvamāveśenāsvatantratā /
analyzed: atha utpattau anitya tvam āveśena asvatantra tā
translated: If there is non-eternality in origination, then there is non-independence due to inherence.

original: nodāharaṇasadbhāvo guṇasaṃkrāntisādhane // //
analyzed: na udāharaṇa sadbhāvaḥ guṇa saṃkrānti sādhane
translated: There is no existence of an example in the proof of the transference of qualities.

original: yairmuktāviśvarasamatā sarvajñatvādiguṇasāmyamutpadyate puṃsa itīṣyate / tanmate
analyzed: yaiḥ muktā viśva rasa matā sarvajña tva ādi guṇa sāmyam utpadyate puṃsaḥ iti iṣyate tad mate
