translated: This manifestation, which is the cause of all worldly conventions, cannot be denied.

original: kālāntarabhāviphalapravṛttikāraṇaṃ savadaiva syāt /🔽satyaṃ grāhako'pyayaṃ ekarūpaḥ sthiragrāhakaprakāśaḥ sarva
analyzed: kāla antara bhāvi phala pravṛtti kāraṇam savadā eva syāt  satyam grāhakaḥ upi ayam eka rūpaḥ sthira grāhaka prakāśaḥ sarva
translated: It would always be the cause of the activity leading to the result that occurs at a later time.

original: vyavahārasaṃpādanakṣamo'napahnavanīya eva / sa punarna svasaṃvedyaḥ / api tu
analyzed: vyavahāra saṃpādana kṣamaḥ ūnapahnavanīyaḥ eva sa punar na sva saṃvedyaḥ api tu
translated: This apprehender, though of one form, is indeed a stable manifestation of the apprehender, capable of accomplishing all worldly conventions, and cannot be denied. But it is not self-cognizable. Rather,

original: grāhakakṣaṇapravāha evānubhūyamāne tatsādṛśyadarśanabhrāntairvikalpenāropya🔽prakāśyayaḥ / tataḥ pravāhasyaivaikyamiti na punarbhrama eva / viṣaya vailakṣaṇyena karmatayā🔽tadaikyasya saṃvedanāt / yadi hyetadāropitaṃ syāt / tadāropikābhimatasya svataḥ kṣaṇamātra🔽dhvaṃsitvenāpratibhāsanāt / tatpratibhāsitve hyātmatvopapatteḥ / āropasya pūrvāparaparāmarśa
analyzed: grāhaka kṣaṇa pravāhe eva anubhūyamāne tad sādṛśya darśana bhrāntaiḥ vikalpena āropya  tatas pravāhasya eva aikyam iti na punar bhramaḥ eva viṣaya vailakṣaṇyena karmatayā  tad aikyasya saṃvedanāt yadi hi etat āropitam syāt tad āropika abhimatasya svatas kṣaṇa mātra  dhvaṃsi tvena apratibhāsanāt tad pratibhāsi tve hi ātma tva upapatteḥ āropasya pūrva apara parāmarśa
translated: it is superimposed by conceptualization, which is deluded by seeing similarity in the mere stream of moments of the apprehender, which is being experienced.🔽Therefore, it is the mere stream that is one. So it is not delusion again. Due to the experience of the oneness of that [stream] as the object,

original: rūpatvena sthirabodhanivartyatvāt / na ca kṣaṇātmano'pi
analyzed: rūpa tvena sthira bodha nivartya tvāt na ca kṣaṇa ātmanaḥ api
translated: with a difference in objects, as the action. If this were a superimposition, then the one who is considered to be superimposing it would not appear as merely a moment due to its momentary destruction. If it did appear, it would be reasonable to be the self. Because the superimposition has the form of the recollection of the past and future, and is to be removed by a stable cognition. And it is not the case that even for one whose nature is momentary,

original: yugapatpūrvāparayuktadīrghaviṣayatvataḥ samāropakatvam /
analyzed: yugapad pūrva apara yukta dīrgha viṣaya tvataḥ samāropaka tvam
translated: The superimposition is due to the simultaneous and sequential connection with the long object.

original: ayojanātmakatvenāvikalpakatvādalātacakrādipratibhāsavat / ata eva yugapat sarvārthaviṣayatve'pi
analyzed: ayojana ātmaka tvena avikalpaka tvāt alāta cakra ādi pratibhāsa vat atas eva yugapad sarva artha viṣaya tve pi
translated: Because of the nature of non-connection, it is non-conceptual, like the appearance of a whirling fire-brand. For this very reason, even though it has all objects as its object simultaneously,

original: yogijñānamavikalpakakalpamityuktam / yojitaviṣayaṃ taditi cet sarveṣāṃ kṣaṇikatvena
analyzed: yogi jñānam avikalpaka kalpam iti uktam yojita viṣayam tat iti ced sarveṣām kṣaṇika tvena
translated: it is said that the knowledge of a yogi is non-conceptual. If it is argued that it has a connected object, since all are momentary,

original: yojanānupapatterna kiñcidetat / ata evānekeṣāmapi kramabhāvināṃ vikalpakṣaṇānāṃ🔽nāropakatvamityāropāsaṃbhavāt tadaṅgatāvikalpanāt / na ca grāhakātmanyeva vaktuṃ
analyzed: yojana anupapatteḥ na kiñcid etat atas eva anekeṣām api krama bhāvinām vikalpa kṣaṇānām  na āropaka tvam iti āropa asaṃbhavāt tad aṅgatā vikalpanāt na ca grāhaka ātmani eva vaktum
translated: the connection is not possible. Therefore, this is nothing. For this very reason, even for many successive moments of conceptual cognition,🔽there is no superimposition. Therefore, since superimposition is not possible, it cannot be a part of conceptual cognition. And it cannot be said to be only in the nature of the apprehender,

original: śakyate / yena svātmanyavikalpako vikalpaḥ / ata evāsyāhaṃ pratyayaviṣayatā'pi na sambhavati /
analyzed: śakyate yena sva ātmani avikalpakaḥ vikalpaḥ atas eva asya aham pratyaya viṣaya tā api na sambhavati
translated: by which conceptual cognition is non-conceptual with regard to its own nature. For this very reason, the object of the notion of I is also not possible for it.

original: api tvahaṃpratyayaprakāśarūpataiva / tadāpi tena rūpeṇa sthiratayaivāhamavabhāsanāt / na hi
analyzed: api tu ahaṃpratyaya prakāśa rūpa tā eva tadā api tena rūpeṇa sthira tayā eva aham avabhāsanāt na hi
translated: Rather, it has the form of the manifestation of the notion of I. Even then, in that form, the I appears as stable. For

original: kālatraye'pi grāhakātmano dhvaṃsaḥ saṃvedyata ityuktam / yasya hi prāgabhāvaḥ
analyzed: kāla traye api grāhaka ātmanaḥ dhvaṃsaḥ saṃvedyate iti uktam yasya hi prāgabhāvaḥ
translated: the destruction of the nature of the apprehender is not experienced even in the three times. It has been said that for one who has prior non-existence,

original: sautpannaḥ / yasya hi puṃsa utpattiḥ sa naṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: sa autpannaḥ yasya hi puṃsaḥ utpattiḥ sa naṣṭaḥ
translated: Saupannaḥ: One whose birth has taken place is destroyed.

original: ahaṃpratyayasya punaḥ pūrvottarayoḥ koṭyornastyabhāvaḥ / saṃvit pratikṣaṇamutpannā
analyzed: ahaṃpratyayasya punar pūrva uttarayoḥ koṭyoḥ saṃvid pratikṣaṇam utpannā
translated: But for the notion of 'I', there is no non-existence in the previous or subsequent moments. Consciousness arises every moment

original: nirūḍhā bhavediti na śakyate vaktum / na vā svasaṃvedyaḥ saṃviddharmo bhavatīti
analyzed: nirūḍhā bhavet iti na śakyate vaktum na vā sva saṃvedyaḥ saṃvid dharmaḥ bhavati iti
translated: and becomes firmly established - this cannot be said. Nor can it be said that the nature of consciousness is not to be known by itself.

original: vakṣyāmaḥ / tatsthūlasūkṣmyoriva sthirakṣaṇikayoḥ parasparaviruddharūpatvād vidyudādau
analyzed: vakṣyāmaḥ tat sthūla sūkṣmyoḥ iva sthira kṣaṇikayoḥ paraspara viruddha rūpa tvāt vidyut ādau
translated: We will say that the nature of consciousness is not to be known by itself. Just as grossness and subtlety, or permanence and momentariness, which are mutually contradictory,

original: kṣaṇikatvaṃ pramāṇasiddhaṃ sadakṣaṇikatvaṃ vyāvartayati / yathaivamatra
analyzed: kṣaṇika tvam pramāṇa siddham sat akṣaṇika tvam vyāvartayati yathā evam atra
translated: the momentariness of lightning etc., which is established by valid means of knowledge, excludes non-momentariness. Just as this is so here,

original: svātmāropāsaṃbhavena sthairyamavabhāsamānamasaṃśayaṃ kṣaṇikatvaṃ vyavacchinattīti
analyzed: sva ātma āropa asaṃbhavena sthairyam avabhāsamānam asaṃśayam kṣaṇikatvam vyavacchinatti iti
translated: the appearance of permanence, which is impossible to superimpose on oneself, undoubtedly excludes momentariness.

original: yuktam / na ca svasaṃvedanasya bādhaḥ saṃbhavati / yena bhrāntatā bhavediti vakṣyamaḥ /
analyzed: yuktam na ca sva saṃvedanasya bādhaḥ saṃbhavati yena bhrānta tā bhavet iti vakṣyamaḥ
translated: And the self-awareness cannot be contradicted, by which there could be delusion - this we will say.

original: na ca pramāṇasiddhasya bādhakaṃ vinā'nyathābhyupagamo matimāvarjayati vipaścitām
analyzed: na ca pramāṇa siddhasya bādhakam vinā anyathā abhyupagamaḥ matim āvarjayati vipaścitām
translated: And the acceptance of something other than what is established by valid means of knowledge, without a contradicting factor, does not attract the minds of the wise.

original: sthirasyārthakriyānupapattireva bādhiketi cenna / tadanupapattestatra niṣetsyamānatvanābādhakatvāt
analyzed: sthirasya arthakriyā anupapattiḥ eva bādhikā iti ced na tad anupapatteḥ tatra niṣetsyamāna tva nābādhaka tvāt
translated: If it is argued that the impossibility of the performance of a stable action is the refutation, it is not so, because that impossibility will be refuted there, and hence it cannot be a refutation.

original: tadatra prakāśe svacittavyayodayasākṣiṇi sthirarūpe hyātmani grāhake svasaṃvedanāt
analyzed: tat atra prakāśe sva citta vyaya udaya sākṣiṇi sthira rūpe hi ātmani grāhake sva saṃvedanāt
translated: Therefore, here in the light, which is the witness of the destruction and origination of one's own mind, in the stable form of the self, which is the apprehender, due to self-awareness,

original: svakartṛtvaṃ proktavadātmasaṃvittiproddhāraphalaṃ parābhihitatadabhāvasādhana
translated: the agency is said to be the extraction of the result of the realization of the self, as stated before. The absence of that, which is stated by others, is the means of refutation.

original: hetuvrātatiraścīnatayā hetukṛtam / na tu smṛtiḥ / sā hyatītādanubhavād bhinnaiva / smartā tu
analyzed: hetu vrāta tiraścīna tayā hetu kṛtam na tu smṛtiḥ sā hi atītāt anubhavāt bhinnā eva smartā tu
translated: It is made by the multitude of reasons, which are contrary to the reasons, but not by memory. For that is indeed different from the experience of the past. But the one who remembers

translated: is not different. Because of the self-awareness of that very one as the experiencer in the past, due to the non-difference from that, the designation is made there.

original: na vastuto'bheda ityalamatisūkṣmānubhavavicāreṇa mugdhamatitapasvijanamanaḥkhedajanakena //🔽evaṃ janmamaraṇayormadhye puṃsaḥ sthairyaṃ pratipādyādhunā yairbhūtebhya eva
analyzed: na vastutas bhedaḥ iti alam ati sūkṣma anubhava vicāreṇa mugdha mati tapasvi jana manaḥ kheda janakena  evam janma maraṇayoḥ madhye puṃsaḥ sthairyam pratipādya adhunā yaiḥ bhūtebhyaḥ eva
translated: But not in reality is there non-difference. Let it be enough to consider the subtle experience, which causes distress to the minds of the deluded people who are greatly suffering.

original: jñānasyotpattirityuktaṃ tān prati janmanaḥ pūrvaṃ sādhayitumāha
analyzed: jñānasya utpattiḥ iti uktam tān prati janmanaḥ pūrvam sādhayitum āha
translated: Having thus explained the stability of the soul in the middle of birth and death, now, for those who have said that knowledge arises from the elements alone, in order to establish that prior to birth, he says:

original: janmāntarānubhūte'rthe smṛtiranyasya saṃbhavet /
analyzed: janma antara anubhūta īrthe smṛtiḥ anyasya saṃbhavet
translated: The memory of an object experienced in a previous birth could belong to another [person].

original: aśanāya bhavet sā ca stanyaṃ pratyupasarpaṇāt // //
analyzed: aśanāya bhavet sā ca stanyam pratyupasarpaṇāt
translated: That [memory] would be for the purpose of eating, because of the approach to the breast.

original: yadi hi śarīreṇa saha caitanyamutpadyate / tadā tadaharjātasya bālakasya🔽bubhukṣitasyāśanāya bhojanārthaṃ stanyaṃ prati kṣīraprāptaye pravṛttirnigaraṇātmako
analyzed: yadi hi śarīreṇa saha caitanyam utpadyate tadā tad ahar jātasya bālakasya  bubhukṣitasya aśanāya bhojana artham stanyam prati kṣīra prāptaye pravṛttiḥ nigaraṇa ātmakā
translated: If consciousness arises together with the body, then for a baby born on that day,

analyzed: vyāpāraḥ na syāt
translated: who is hungry, the activity of eating, which is the act of swallowing, for the purpose of eating, for the sake of obtaining food, for the sake of obtaining milk, would not exist.

translated: arrangement of the sense organs, the upward movement of the vital breath, and the striking of the locations, do not occur without

analyzed: śabda bhāvanām iti tatratyaḥ pāṭhaḥ pūrva vedanām vā pa  iti dṛśyate ca  pravṛttiḥ sā janma antara pūrvikām smṛtim tadā gamayati nanu yathā
translated: the prior experience of sound. The text there reads: and the prior experience of sound. And activity is seen.🔽That [activity] indicates the memory belonging to a previous birth at that time. But just as the arising of yawning and so on

original: bālasya jātidharmatayā vastuśaktita eva bhavati / evametadapi bhaviṣyatītyasamañjasametat /
analyzed: bālasya jāti dharma tayā vastu śaktitaḥ eva bhavati evam etat api bhaviṣyati iti asamañjasam etat
translated: in a baby is due to the power of the thing itself, being a natural characteristic of birth, in the same way this [memory] will also be [due to the power of the thing itself]. This is not coherent.

analyzed: avagama pūrvaka tvāt asya sarvasya hi avagamam vinā nā udbhavaḥ keśa nakha ādeḥ iva tasya
translated: Because all this is preceded by understanding. For without understanding, there is no origination of this, like that of hair, nails, etc.

original: nānābhūtānekakāryakartrekatvasvabhāvatvāt krameṇa nānābhūtārthakriyākaraṇe'pi
analyzed: nānā bhūta aneka kārya kartṛ ekatva svabhāva tvāt krameṇa nānā bhūta arthakriyā karaṇe pi
translated: because of the nature of being the producer of various non-existent multiple effects in sequence, even when producing the effects of various non-existent things,

original: na svabhāvabhedaḥ / yathikasyaiva caitrasya lavanapacanabhojanādyanekakāryakartuśca
analyzed: na svabhāva bhedaḥ yathikasya eva caitrasya lavana pacana bhojana ādi aneka kārya kartuḥ ca
translated: There is no difference in nature. Just as the same Caitra, who performs many actions such as grinding, cooking, eating, etc.,

analyzed: svabhāva bhedaḥ tathābhūta svabhāvasya tatra krameṇa eva bhāvāt  pradīpasya hi ekasya eva varti dahana taila kṣapaṇa sva jñāpana adya
translated: there is no difference in nature. Because that very nature exists there in sequence.

original: nekakāryanirvartakaikasvabhāvo'bhyupagato bhavadbhiḥ / na tu kāryabhedena svabhāvabhedaḥ /
analyzed: neka kārya nirvartaka eka svabhāvaḥ bhavadbhiḥ na tu kārya bhedena svabhāva bhedaḥ
translated: For you accept that a single lamp performs many actions such as burning the wick, consuming the oil, illuminating, etc., and has a single nature as the agent of those actions. But there is no difference in nature due to the difference in actions.

original: ekasyaiva viśiṣṭasvabhāvasyānekakāryanirvartanavirodhābhāvāt / tadvadatrābhyupagantavyam /🔽tattatsahakārisannidhau tattadanekakāryakaraṇasvabhāvāviyogāt sarvadaiva sthirasyā'pi bhāvasya
analyzed: ekasya eva viśiṣṭa svabhāvasya aneka kārya nirvartana virodha abhāvāt tadvat atra abhyupagantavyam  tad tad sahakāri sannidhau tad tad aneka kārya karaṇa svabhāva aviyogāt sarvadā eva sthirasya api bhāvasya
translated: Because there is no contradiction in a single specific nature performing many actions. It should be accepted in the same way here.

original: sahakārisannidhānasya pūrvavat kramikatvāt krameṇānekakāryanirvartane'pi na bhedasvabhāvo

translated: Even though the entity is permanent, it is always inseparable from the nature of performing those various actions in the presence of those various auxiliaries, because the presence of the auxiliaries is sequential as before. Even though it performs many actions in sequence, there is no difference in nature.

original: bhedāditi sthirasyārthakriyākartṛtvaṃ krameṇa yujyata iti nārthakriyāsaṃbhavasyātra

translated: that has been examined by us in the Āgamāmañjarī. Therefore, it should be understood from there.

original: tatra bādhakābhāvāt sthairyaṃ bhāvānāṃ pratyakṣasiddhamabādhitameva /

translated: There, stability of things is established by perception and is not contradicted, because there is no contradiction.

original: tatraiṣāṃ hetuḥ pramāṇena siddhaḥ / te vinaśvarāstadanye tvavinaśvarā
analyzed: tatra eṣām hetuḥ pramāṇena siddhaḥ te vinaśvarāḥ tad anye tu avinaśvarā
translated: There, their cause is established by means of a valid means of knowledge. Those are perishable, but the others are🔽indeed imperishable.

analyzed: eva iti ātmanaḥ ṛthakriyā kartṛ tve pi avināśaḥ siddhaḥ hetu abhāvāt etena  jña tva virodhaḥ upi ātmanaḥ prāc uktaḥ tad tad viṣaya sannidhau tad tad grāhaka eka svabhāva tvena pūrvavat
translated: Even in the case of the self being a cause of an effect, non-destruction is established, because of the absence of a cause. By this,🔽the contradiction with cognition, which was stated earlier regarding the self, is also refuted. Due to having the same nature as the apprehender of each object in the presence of each object, as before,

translated: which are of the nature of coverings, known as impurities, actions, and māyā, along with ignorance, are then ceased, and because the apprehender, which is uncovered, remains.

original: yadāhuḥ prabhāsvaramidaṃ cittaṃ prakṛtyāgantavo malāḥ / teṣāmabhāve sarvārthaṃ
analyzed: yat āhuḥ prabhāsvaram idam cittam prakṛti āgantavaḥ malāḥ teṣām abhāve sarva artham
translated: As it is said: This mind is luminous by nature, the impurities are adventitious. In their absence, it is all-purpose,

original: tajjyotiravinaśvaram // iti //
analyzed: tat jyotiḥ a vinaśvaram iti
translated: that light is indestructible.

translated: As they say: The brilliance of one is distinguished from another. But even if the object exists, the pure

translated: As it is said: The manifestation of one [thing] is distinguished from another. If, however, they do not see even an existent object without impurity, then in liberation they accept even a contradictory entity by the power of reasoning. There, he says the true Lord.

original: saccāsau pramāṇasiddhatvādīśvaraśca / tasmin jñānakriyayornityatvadarśanāduktānumānena🔽bādhā'sya pakṣasya / ayamarthaḥ padārthasaṃgrahavādinā tāvadīśvarasya dravyapadārtha🔽eva / tatrāpi cātmapadārtha eva saṃgraho vācyo nānyatra / atyantavilakṣaṇatvena tadayogāt /

translated: He is true and also a Lord, because he is established by valid means of knowledge. Even there, the collection should be stated as the category of self, not elsewhere, because it is not suitable due to being extremely different.

analyzed: idānīm avyākṛta ādiṣu ityādinā pūrva uddiṣṭān pakṣān pratikṣipati
translated: Now, in the unmanifested and so on, with etc. he refutes the previously mentioned positions.

analyzed: prayāsaḥ tad laya vādinām iti syāt etat yadi api pralaye tatra sarve eva jīvātmānaḥ baddhā
translated: of those merged in that and so on is pointless. This may be said: Even though in the dissolution all the individual souls, both bound

original: tadvikārāṇāṃ paramakāraṇamapi cetanāmcetanātmakaṃ syāt / na🔽caitanmātuvaṃndhyātvamiva brahmaṇāpi śakyamavasthāpayitum / atha kaścidbhāgastasya

original: siddhyatīti teṣāṃ ca cetanatvānna kāryatvam / yaccoktamanvayāt kāryatvamiti / tadapyayuktam /

In the awareness of each self, whose connection is where? If it is so,

original: saṃbhavāt / asattve tu kāraṇaṃ sannabādhakaṃ vaktavyam / bādhakamantareṇa
analyzed: saṃbhavāt asattve tu kāraṇam sanna bādhakam vaktavyam bādhakam antareṇa
translated: possible. But in the case of non-existence, a non-contradictory cause must be stated. Without a contradiction,

original: sarvabhāvānāṃ sattvamanubhavasiddhaṃ prekṣāvatāṃ na tyaktumucitaṃ yataḥ /🔽syādetat / paravijñeyānāṃ sarvathā paramāṇurūpatayā sthūlādyātmakatayā'pi🔽vicārayitumaśakyatvādavastutvena svapnavadavidyārūpatvaṃ svanirūpaṇākṣamatvaṃ
analyzed: sarva bhāvānām sattvam anubhava siddham prekṣāvatām na tyaktum ucitam yatas  syāt etat para vijñeyānām sarvathā paramāṇu rūpa tayā sthūla ādi ātmaka tayā api  vicārayitum aśakya tvāt avastu tvena svapna vat avidyā rūpa tvam sva nirūpaṇa akṣama tvam
translated: the existence of all things, established by experience, should not be abandoned by the wise, because it is so.🔽This may be so. Since the forms of others' consciousness cannot be investigated at all as atomic in nature, or even as having the nature of grossness, etc.,🔽their unreal nature is like a dream, or the nature of ignorance is incapable of being defined by itself,

original: vā'vidyāyāḥ svarūpam / svanirūpaṇakṣamatvameva vidyāyāḥ svarūpaṃ yataḥ /
analyzed: vā avidyāyāḥ svarūpam sva nirūpaṇa kṣamatvam eva vidyāyāḥ svarūpam yatas
translated: because the nature of knowledge is capable of being defined by itself.

original: bodhātmavastunastu tadaikasvabhāvatayā tadvyavasthāpakatvena svataḥ siddherna
analyzed: bodha ātma vastunaḥ tu tad aika svabhāva tayā tad vyavasthāpaka tvena svatas siddheḥ na
translated: But for the object which is of the nature of consciousness, because it is of the same nature as that [consciousness], it is established by itself as that which determines it.

original: tathātvamidamasattvakāraṇaṃ sattābādhakamiti /
analyzed: tathātvam idam asattva kāraṇam sattā bādhakam iti
translated: But for the existent entity which is of the nature of cognition, because it is established by itself as being of the same nature as that [cognition] and as the determiner of that [cognition],🔽this [cognition] is not a cause of non-existence, nor does it contradict existence.

original: tatra vicāraḥ puruṣapratibhātmajanmakaḥ pramāṇaviśeṣaḥ / yadi ca
analyzed: tatra vicāraḥ puruṣa pratibhā ātma janmakaḥ pramāṇa viśeṣaḥ yadi ca
translated: There, the investigation is a special means of knowledge born from the soul's own power. And if

original: puruṣapramāṇamavidyā'pasmārākrāntatayā pratibhāvaikalyena
analyzed: puruṣa pramāṇam avidyā apasmāra ākrānta tayā pratibhā vaikalyena
translated: the human means of knowledge, being seized by the epilepsy of ignorance and being devoid of the power of discrimination,

original: bhāvasvabhāvanirūpaṇāsāmarthyayuktam / kimetāvatā bhāvairaparāddham / yena tenābhāvā
analyzed: bhāva svabhāva nirūpaṇa sāmarthya yuktam kim etāvatā bhāvaiḥ aparāddham yena tena abhāvāḥ
translated: is incapable of determining the nature of existence, what wrong have the existents done by that [means of knowledge] that they are declared to be

original: asantaḥ kathitāḥ / nahyeṣa sthāṇoraparādho yadenamandho na paśyatīti / puruṣāparādhastu
analyzed: asantaḥ kathitāḥ na hi eṣa sthāṇoḥ aparādhaḥ yat enam andhaḥ na paśyati iti puruṣa aparādhaḥ tu
translated: non-existent? For it is not the fault of the post that a blind man does not see it. But it is the fault of the man

original: bhavati / vicārayitumaśakyatvena ca bhāvānāṃ tadviṣayaḥ saṃśayo yuktaḥ /
analyzed: bhavati vicārayitum aśakya tvena ca bhāvānām tad viṣayaḥ saṃśayaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: that [the post is not seen]. And because of the impossibility of investigating existents, doubt regarding them is proper.

original: tatsādhakabādhakapramāṇābhāvena tasya nyāyaprāptatvāt / na tvasattāniścaya iti
analyzed: tad sādhaka bādhaka pramāṇa abhāvena tasya nyāya prāpta tvāt na tu asattā niścaye iti
translated: Because that [doubt] is obtained by reasoning through the absence of means of knowledge that establish or contradict [the existence of existents], not by the ascertainment of non-existence.

original: bhāvasvabhāvavicāreṇa pravṛtteḥ sādhu tadvicāraḥ kṛtaḥ / saṃśayasyaiva
analyzed: bhāva svabhāva vicāreṇa pravṛtteḥ sādhu tad vicāraḥ kṛtaḥ saṃśayasya eva
translated: Since [the investigation] proceeds by the investigation of the nature of existents, that investigation is well done. Doubt itself is

original: gopālāṅganābālasthavirasthasyetthaṃ siddhāntitatvāt / na ca vicārayituṃ śakyatvameva
analyzed: gopāla aṅganā bāla sthavira sthasya ittham siddhāntita tvāt na ca vicārayitum śakya tvam eva
translated: Because it has been established thus for the cowherds, young women, children, and elders. And the very possibility of investigating

original: bhāvānām / pūrvaṃ jñānakāṇḍa eva vistareṇa vicāritatvāditi nāto'pi teṣāmasatyatvam /
analyzed: bhāvānām pūrvam jñāna kāṇḍe eva vistareṇa vicārita tvāt iti teṣām asatya tvam
translated: the entities has not been established. Because it has been investigated in detail earlier in the section on knowledge. Therefore, they are not unreal for this reason either.

original: nanūktaṃ prāk / brahmaiva satyam / asatyāstu bhedā iti / siddhārthapratipādakatvenāpi
analyzed: nanu uktam prāk brahma eva satyam asatyāḥ tu bhedāḥ iti siddhārtha pratipādaka tvena api
translated: But it was said earlier that Brahman alone is real, and the differences are unreal. Even if the Veda is a means of valid knowledge by teaching what is already established,

original: śruteḥ pramāṇatvāt śrutitaḥ sadasadvyavastheti / yadyevaṃ pramāṇatvādatra
analyzed: śruteḥ pramāṇa tvāt śrutitaḥ sat asat vyavasthā iti yadi evam pramāṇa tvāt atra
translated: the distinction between real and unreal is based on the Veda. If it is so, then due to being a means of valid knowledge, even the Vedic statements here

original: śrutivākyānāmapi satyatve brahmaiva satyamityadvaitavirodhaḥ /
analyzed: śruti vākyānām api satya tve brahma eva satyam iti advaita virodhaḥ
translated: are real, and there is a contradiction with non-dualism in Brahman alone being real.

original: pramāṇaprameyādisattānibandhanatvādadvaitasya / athaitānyapi śrutivākyānyasatyānyeveṣyate /🔽yadyevamapramāṇatvāditthameṣāṃ brahmasatyatvasiddhau bhedāsatyatve ca pramāṇāntaraṃ
analyzed: pramāṇa prameya ādi sattā nibandhana tvāt advaitasya atha etāni api śruti vākyāni asatyāni eva iṣyate  yadi evam apramāṇa tvāt ittham eṣām brahma satya tva siddhau bheda asatya tve ca pramāṇa antaram
translated: Because non-duality is based on the existence of means of valid knowledge, objects of valid knowledge, etc. If these Vedic statements are also considered unreal,

original: vaktavyam / nahyasatyaṃ pramāṇaṃ bandhyāsutajñānamiva bhavati yataḥ / pramāṇāntare
analyzed: vaktavyam na hi asatyam pramāṇam bandhyā suta jñānam iva bhavati yatas pramāṇa antare
translated: if so, then due to being a means of valid knowledge, the truth of Brahman and the unreality of differences should be stated by another means of valid knowledge. For a means of valid knowledge is not unreal, like the knowledge of the son of a barren woman. Therefore, another means of valid knowledge🔽must be stated.

original: cākṣepapratisamādhāne pūrvokte evetyanavasthiterna satyādvaitasiddhiḥ / paramārthato
analyzed: ca ākṣepa pratisamādhāne pūrva ukte eva iti anavasthiteḥ na satya advaita siddhiḥ
translated: The objections and replies stated before are the same, so there is no establishment of the truth of non-duality. In the ultimate sense,

original: bhedo'styeveti kathamitthamadvaitasvabhāvānyeva tānīti kasya kva pramāṇāni /🔽dvaitanibandhanatvāt🔽pramāṇaprameyavyavasthiteḥ / satyametatparamārthato'yamavidyārūpa eva🔽pramāṇādivyavahāra iti cet / nanu sa evāyaṃ vicāryate / pramāṇānāmasatyatvādeṣo'pi
analyzed: bhedaḥ usti eva iti katham ittham advaita svabhāvāni eva tāni iti kasya kva pramāṇāni  dvaita nibandhana tvāt  pramāṇa prameya vyavasthiteḥ satyam etat paramārthataḥ yam avidyā rūpaḥ eva  pramāṇa ādi vyavahāraḥ iti ced nanu saḥ eva ayam vicāryate pramāṇānām asatya tvāt eṣaḥ api
translated: there is indeed difference. How then are those of the nature of non-duality in this way? Whose are they? Where are they? What are the means of valid knowledge?

original: niścayo bhavato'pramā / etacca yadavagataṃ tadasatyameva dvicandrādivaditi /
analyzed: niścayaḥ bhavatā upramā etat ca yat avagatam tat asatyam eva dvi candra ādi vat iti
translated: Because the establishment of means of valid knowledge and objects of valid knowledge is based on duality. If it is said that this is true, that this usage of means of valid knowledge etc. is indeed of the nature of ignorance in the ultimate sense, then indeed this is being considered. Because the means of valid knowledge are false, this ascertainment of yours is also a non-valid cognition. And this which is known is indeed false, like the two moons etc.

original: brahmaṇo'pyasatyatvāt sarvābhāvo vedārthaḥ sādhu nirūpitaḥ prajñāśālibhiḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇā upi asatya tvāt sarva abhāvaḥ veda arthaḥ sādhu nirūpitaḥ prajñā śālibhiḥ
translated: Because Brahman is also false, the meaning of the Vedas is the negation of everything, well described by the wise.

original: nanvavidyārūpāṇyapi śrutivākyāni vidyopāyabhūtānyeveti / idaṃ
analyzed: nanu avidyā rūpāṇi api śruti vākyāni vidyā upāya bhūtāni eva iti idam
translated: But it is said that even the statements of the Vedas, which are of the nature of ignorance, are indeed the means of attaining knowledge. This

original: mugdhaśrotriyapratārakamucyate / pramāṇānāmasatyatve sarvametanmanorājyatulyam / satyatve
analyzed: mugdha śrotriya pratārakam ucyate pramāṇānām asatya tve sarvam etat manaḥ rājya tulyam satya tve
translated: is said to be a deception of the innocent Vedic scholar. When the means of valid knowledge are false, all this is like a mental creation. If they are true,

original: vā dvaitapakṣa eva prakāśate / tadabhede hi sarvamevedaṃ brahmeti kastatra kasya kiṃ
analyzed: vā dvaita pakṣaḥ eva prakāśate tad abhede hi sarvam eva idam brahma iti kaḥ tatra kasya kim
translated: or the duality-view alone shines. For if there is non-difference, then all this is Brahman. Who there does what to whom?

original: kuryādityasaṅgatam / bimbasya na tatra bhrāntiḥ sambhavati / bhrāntimapi svapnādivijñānaṃ
analyzed: kuryāt iti asaṅgatam bimbasya na tatra bhrāntiḥ sambhavati bhrāntim api svapna ādi vijñānam
translated: Thus it is irrelevant. There is no possibility of delusion regarding the reflected image. Even delusion, the dream-consciousness etc.,

original: sarvamālambate bhrāntaṃ na svātmani / ālambanaṃ ca bahisthitamanyathā pratīyamānaṃ
analyzed: sarvam ālambate bhrāntam na sva ātmani ālambanam ca bahis sthitam anyathā pratīyamānam
translated: all depend on an object. What is deluded is not in itself. And the object, situated externally, appearing otherwise,

original: bhramaviṣayatāmāpādayati / yutpunarbodhaikasvabhāvaṃ vastu tadyathaiva cāksti tathaiva tataḥ
analyzed: bhrama viṣaya tām āpādayati yut punar bodha eka svabhāvam vastu tat yathā eva tathā eva tatas
translated: brings about the state of being the object of delusion. But again, the object which has the nature of knowledge alone, just as it exists, in the same way

original: svasaṃvedyasya tatsvabhāvatvāyogāt / tatsvabhāvatve vā svasaṃvedyameveti svasaṃvedane
analyzed: sva saṃvedyasya tad svabhāva tva ayogāt tad svabhāva tve vā sva saṃvedyam eva iti sva saṃvedane
translated: it is known by itself. Because it is not possible for what is to be known by itself to have that nature. Or if it had that nature, it would be known by itself.

original: bhrāntyasaṃbhavādātmabhedaḥ pratyekaṃ parātmānumātṛtayā svasaṃvedanena siddhaḥ🔽satya eva / śrutirapyāha tameva bhāntamanubhāti sarvaṃ tasya bhāsā sarvamidaṃ vibhāti
analyzed: bhrānti asaṃbhavāt ātma bhedaḥ pratyekam parātma anumātṛ tayā sva saṃvedanena siddhaḥ  satye eva śrutiḥ api āha tam eva bhāntam anubhāti sarvam tasya bhāsā sarvam idam vibhāti
translated: In the knowledge of itself, because delusion is not possible, the difference of the self is established by each one as the inferrer of the other self,

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: only when it is true. The Veda also says: All this shines after Him who shines. By His light all this shines.

original: nanvitaretarābhāvasiddhyapekṣatvād bhedasya bhāvaviṣayatvācca pratyakṣasya kathaṃ
analyzed: nanu itaretarābhāva siddhi apekṣa tvāt bhedasya bhāva viṣaya tvāt ca pratyakṣasya katham
translated: But how is it that difference, which depends on the establishment of mutual absence and which has existence as its object, is the object of perception?

original: bhedaḥ pratyakṣaḥ / taduktam āhurvidhātṛ pratyakṣam / iti /
analyzed: bhedaḥ pratyakṣaḥ tat uktam iti
translated: Difference is perceived. As it is said, they declare the creator to be perceived.

original: netaretarābhāvasiddhyapekṣā bhedaikyam / tarhi siddhe bhede taditaretarābhāvapratipattiḥ /
analyzed: na itaretarābhāva siddhi apekṣā bheda aikyam tarhi siddhe bhede tad itaretarābhāva pratipattiḥ
translated: Difference and unity do not depend on the establishment of mutual absence. Then, when difference is established, the cognition of mutual absence follows.

original: sarvaikye hi na kasyacit kutaścidabhāva iti ghaṭārthī paṭadarśanāt kimiti nivartate / pramāṇā
analyzed: sarva aikye hi na kasyacid kutaścid abhāvaḥ iti ghaṭa arthī paṭa darśanāt kim iti nivartate
translated: For if everything were one, then nothing would be absent from anywhere. So why would one seeking a pot turn back from seeing a cloth? Because of the means of knowledge.

original: pramāṇatadavibhāgaśca na syāt / sattāmātrāvyabhicārāt / sarvajñānāmapratyakṣasiddho
analyzed: pramāṇa tad avibhāgaḥ ca na syāt sattā mātra avyabhicārāt sarvajñānām a pratyakṣa siddhaḥ
translated: And there would be no distinction between the means of knowledge and its result, because of invariable concomitance with mere existence. The difference of all cognitions is not established by perception.

original: bheda eveti kathamasatyatvaṃ pāṭhamātreṇa sādhyate / bhavatu satyam / tathā'pi
analyzed: bhedaḥ eva iti katham asatya tvam pāṭha mātreṇa sādhyate bhavatu satyam tathā api
translated: How is unreality established by mere text? Let it be real. Even so,

original: brahmopādānaṃ hyetaditi śrutitastadupādānaṃ brahma bhaviṣyatīti / tarhyetadevātroktaṃ
analyzed: brahma upādānam hi etat iti śrutitaḥ tat upādānam brahma bhaviṣyati iti tarhi etat eva atra uktam
translated: this is the material cause of Brahman, thus it is stated in the Upanishad. Therefore, the material cause will be Brahman. Then what is stated here by the commentator

original: vṛttikṛtā kimarthamākṣepaḥ / upādāneṣu līnānāṃ punarāvartanam iti / atra cokto doṣa
analyzed: vṛtti kṛtā kimartham ākṣepaḥ upādāneṣu līnānām punar āvartanam iti atra ca uktaḥ doṣa
translated: for what purpose is the objection? The return of those merged in the material causes. And the fault stated here

original: ityāha upādāneti // //
analyzed: iti āha upādāna iti
translated: is said to be due to the material cause, etc.

original: nanu ca ānandaṃ brahmaṇo rūpam iti śrūyate / tena ca rūpeṇa parāvṛttyayogāt /
analyzed: nanu ca ānandam brahmaṇaḥ rūpam iti śrūyate tena ca rūpeṇa parāvṛtti ayogāt
translated: But it is heard that bliss is a form of Brahman. And because of the impossibility of Brahman turning away from that form,

original: sthūlarūpaparāvartane'pi na tallīnānāṃ bhaviṣyati parāvṛttidoṣa ityāha
analyzed: sthūla rūpa parāvartane api na tad līnānām bhaviṣyati parāvṛtti doṣaḥ iti āha
translated: Even when turning away from the gross form, there will not be the fault of turning away for those absorbed in it, he says:

original: vijñānamātramānandaṃ vastu satyaṃ na tatra hi /
analyzed: vijñāna mātram ānandam vastu satyam na tatra hi
translated: In that reality, which is mere consciousness and bliss, there is no such thing.

original: naivaṃvidhamupādānaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ tantvādi sūrayaḥ //
analyzed: na evaṃvidham upādānam dṛṣṭam tantu ādi sūrayaḥ
translated: The wise have not seen such a material cause as thread, etc.

original: he sūrayaḥ paṇḍitāḥ / tatra brahmaṇi vijñānaṃ paramārthato nāsti /
analyzed: he sūrayaḥ paṇḍitāḥ tatra brahmaṇi vijñānam paramārthataḥ na asti
translated: O wise ones, in that Brahman, consciousness does not exist in reality.

original: paṭādyupādānānaṃ tantvādīnāmivopādānakāraṇatvāt // //
analyzed: tantu ādīnām iva upādānakāraṇa tvāt
translated: Because it is the material cause, like the material causes of cloth etc. such as thread etc.

original: kathaṃ tarhyetāḥ śrutaya ityāha
analyzed: katham tarhi etāḥ śrutayaḥ iti āha
translated: How then are these scriptural statements? He says:

original: bhuvanatve niviṣṭasya tatsthitasyopapadyate /
analyzed: bhuvana tve niviṣṭasya tad sthitasya upapadyate
translated: For one who is confined in the world, who abides there,

original: guṇatastatra saṃsthānāṃ bhogināṃ mukhyalakṣaṇam //
analyzed: guṇataḥ tatra saṃsthānām bhoginām mukhya lakṣaṇam
translated: the primary characteristic of the enjoyers who are situated there is possible as a quality.

original: tadvijñānarūpatvaṃ tasya brahmaṇo bhuvananimittaṃ bhogadātṛtayā pariṇatasya guṇata
analyzed: tad vijñāna rūpa tvam tasya brahmaṇaḥ bhuvana nimittam bhoga dātṛ tayā pariṇatasya
translated: That Brahman, which has the form of consciousness, is said to be the cause of the world figuratively, not primarily, because it has transformed itself into the giver of enjoyment.

original: upacārataḥ kathyate na mukhyataḥ / bhuvanasthabhoktṛvijñānayogāt / mañcāḥ krośantītivad
analyzed: upacārataḥ kathyate na mukhyataḥ bhuvana stha bhoktṛ vijñāna yogāt mañcāḥ krośanti itivat
translated: Because it is connected with the consciousness of the enjoyers who are in the world, like the statement the benches are shouting.

original: vijñānaṃ brahmaṇo rūpamityupacāreṇa śrutayo vyākhyeyā ityarthaḥ / yadāhuḥ
analyzed: vijñānam brahmaṇaḥ rūpam iti upacāreṇa śrutayaḥ vyākhyeyāḥ iti arthaḥ yat āhuḥ
translated: The meaning is that the scriptural statements should be explained figuratively as consciousness is the form of Brahman. As they say:

original: tatreti / tatra bhuvanasthitānāṃ bhogināmātmanāmetanmukhyarūpaṃ na brahmaṇa iti // //
analyzed: tatra iti tatra bhuvana sthitānām bhoginām ātmanām etat mukhya rūpam na brahmaṇaḥ iti
translated: There, among those who are enjoying the worlds, this is the primary form of the selves, not of Brahman.

original: tarhi tathābhūtabhuvanaprāptirūpo'smākaṃ mokṣo bhaviṣyatītyāha
analyzed: tarhi tathābhūta bhuvana prāpti rūpaḥ usmākam mokṣaḥ bhaviṣyati iti āha
translated: Then, our liberation will be in the form of attaining such a world. He says:

original: bhuvanasya vināśitvaṃ dṛṣṭatvāt tadvināśane /
analyzed: bhuvanasya vināśi tvam dṛṣṭa tvāt tad vināśane
translated: Because the destruction of the world has been seen, in its destruction,

original: tadbhoktṝṇāmapi bhavet tenaiṣā na dhruvā gatiḥ // //
analyzed: tad bhoktṝṇām api bhavet tena eṣā na dhruvā gatiḥ
translated: there would be for the enjoyers of that world also. Therefore, this liberation is not permanent.

original: bhuvanavināśād dṛṣṭo bhoktṛvināśa iti so'pyadhruvo mokṣaḥ // //🔽tadiyatā paramātmalayapakṣaṃ pratikṣipyādhunā kaivalyamokṣaṃ
analyzed: bhuvana vināśāt dṛṣṭaḥ bhoktṛ vināśaḥ iti saḥ upi adhruvaḥ mokṣaḥ  tat iyatā paramātma laya pakṣam pratikṣipya adhunā kaivalya mokṣam
translated: Because the destruction of the enjoyers has been seen from the destruction of the world, that liberation is also impermanent.

original: pratikṣipati
analyzed: pratikṣipati
translated: Having thus refuted the view of merging into the supreme self, he now refutes the liberation of mere isolation.

original: guṇatattvordhvabhogyasya karmaṇo'nupalabdhitaḥ /
analyzed: guṇa tattva ūrdhva bhogyasya karmaṇaḥ anupalabdhitaḥ
translated: From the non-perception of the action to be enjoyed above the principle of qualities,

original: kaivalyamapi sāṃkhyānāṃ naiva yuktamasaṃkṣayāt // //
analyzed: kaivalyam api sāṃkhyānām nā eva yuktam asaṃkṣayāt
translated: even the isolation of the Sāṃkhyas is not proper due to the non-exhaustion.

original: sāṃkhyānāṃ muktau karmakṣayato bhoktṛtvanivṛttyātmakaṃ yat kaivalyaṃ tadayuktam /
analyzed: sāṃkhyānām muktau karma kṣayataḥ bhoktṛ tva nivṛtti ātmakam yat kaivalyam tat ayuktam
translated: In the liberation of the Sāṃkhyas, the isolation which is in the form of the cessation of being an enjoyer due to the destruction of action is not proper.

original: kutaḥ / ityatrāha asaṃkṣayāditi / guṇatattvordhvabhogyasya karmaṇa iti saṃbandhaḥ /
analyzed: kutas iti atra āha asaṃkṣayāt iti guṇa tattva ūrdhva bhogyasya karmaṇaḥ iti saṃbandhaḥ
translated: Why? In this regard, he says due to the non-exhaustion. The connection is of the action to be enjoyed above the principle of qualities.

original: yadyapi guṇabhoktṛtvaṃ nivṛttaṃ sāṃkhyamuktānām / tathāpi guṇatattvādupari sāṃkhyāpari
analyzed: yadi api guṇa bhoktṛ tvam nivṛttam sāṃkhya muktānām tathā api guṇa tattvāt upari sāṃkhya apari
translated: Although the enjoyment of the qualities has ceased for the liberated Sāṃkhyas, even then, above the principle of the qualities, there is the principle of the self.

original: dṛṣṭarāgavidyāditattvaviṣayāṇi karmāṇyakṣīṇānīti tadbhoktṛtvamanivṛttameva yataḥ / kathaṃ
analyzed: dṛṣṭa rāga vidyā ādi tattva viṣayāṇi karmāṇi akṣīṇāni iti tad bhoktṛ tvam anivṛttam eva yatas katham
translated: Although the enjoyment of the qualities has ceased for the liberated Sāṃkhyas, still, above the principle of the qualities, there are actions whose objects are the principles of passion, knowledge, etc., which are not seen by the Sāṃkhyas. Therefore, the state of being an enjoyer of those has not ceased at all. How then

original: teṣāṃ karmaṇāṃ tadā na kṣaya ityāha anupalabdhita iti / upalabdhirbhogaḥ / yaduktam🔽bhogo'sya vedanā puṃsaḥ iti / tadabhāvo'nupalabdhiḥ / tataḥ krameṇoparyupari
analyzed: teṣām karmaṇām tadā na kṣayaḥ iti āha anupalabdhitaḥ iti upalabdhiḥ bhogaḥ yat uktam  bhogaḥ usya vedanā puṃsaḥ iti tad abhāvaḥ anupalabdhiḥ tatas krameṇa upari upari
translated: is there no destruction of those actions at that time? He says because of non-experience. Experience is enjoyment. As it is said:

original: sthitatattvaviṣayāṇi karmāṇi bhoktavyānīti / na tāvat tastāni bhuktāni yata ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: sthita tattva viṣayāṇi karmāṇi bhoktavyāni iti na tāvat tāni bhuktāni yatas iti arthaḥ
translated: The enjoyment of the soul is feeling. The absence of that is non-experience. Therefore, the actions whose objects are the principles situated higher and higher should be enjoyed in order. The meaning is: those have not yet been enjoyed.

original: nanu jñānāgniḥ sarvakarmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute'rjuna / iti🔽sāṃkhyajñānāt kathamakṣīṇāni tānyucyante / guṇapuruṣāntarakhyātimātraphalaṃ
analyzed: nanu jñāna agniḥ sarva karmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute īrjuna iti  sāṃkhya jñānāt katham akṣīṇāni tāni ucyante guṇa puruṣa antara khyāti mātra phalam
translated: But isn't it said: The fire of knowledge reduces all actions to ashes, O Arjuna.🔽How are those said to be not destroyed by the knowledge of the Sāṃkhya? The knowledge of the Sāṃkhya has as its result only the knowledge of the difference between the qualities and the soul.

original: sāṃkhyajñānamiti tadupari karmakṣayasya kaḥ prasaṅgaḥ / nanu guṇanivṛttyaiva
analyzed: sāṃkhya jñānam iti tad upari karma kṣayasya kaḥ prasaṅgaḥ nanu guṇa nivṛttyā eva
translated: What connection is there of the destruction of actions above that? But isn't it that by the cessation of the qualities alone,

original: buddhyādikaraṇānāmapi nivṛtteḥ kathaṃ te /āṃ karaṇaurvinopabhogaḥ / na tu guṇapravṛttiḥ
analyzed: buddhi ādi karaṇānām api nivṛtteḥ katham teām karaṇauḥ vinā upabhogaḥ na tu guṇa pravṛttiḥ
translated: How can there be enjoyment of the senses when the organs like the intellect have ceased to function? Not the activity of the qualities.

original: karaṇasaṃbandhaheturātmanām / api tu samatve sati karmāṇi / yaduktam karmataśca śarīrāṇi
analyzed: karaṇa saṃbandha hetuḥ ātmanām api tu samatve sati karmāṇi yat uktam karmataḥ ca śarīrāṇi
translated: The cause of the connection with the organs is the actions of the souls, not their equality. As it has been said: And from actions come the bodies,

original: viṣayāḥ kāraṇāni ca / iti / karmāṇi coktāni tāvat teṣāṃ santīti🔽kāraṇānāmapyanivṛtteḥ / tatra bhoktṛtve śaṅkā kevalataiveti / kiṃ tarhi sāṃkhyajñānāt
analyzed: viṣayāḥ kāraṇāni ca svāḥ iti karmāṇi ca uktāni tāvat teṣām santi iti  kāraṇānām api anivṛtteḥ tatra bhoktṛ tve śaṅkā kevala tā eva iti kim tarhi sāṃkhya jñānāt
translated: the objects, and the causes. And actions have been mentioned, so they exist.🔽And because the causes have not ceased, the doubt about their being the enjoyers is only due to their being mere instruments. Then what?

original: teṣāṃ nivṛtam / kimanyannivartyatāṃ guṇa bhoktṛtvanivṛttireveti // //
analyzed: teṣām nivṛtam kim anyat nivartyatām guṇa bhoktṛ tva nivṛttiḥ eva iti
translated: Their cessation is only by the knowledge of the Sankhyas. What else is to be ceased? Only the cessation of being the enjoyers of the qualities.

original: atra sāṃkhyaviśeṣadṛṣṭyā paraḥ sarvakarmakṣayaṃ teṣāṃ bhogena darśayati
analyzed: atra sāṃkhya viśeṣa dṛṣṭyā paraḥ sarva karma kṣayam teṣām bhogena darśayati
translated: Here, from the Sankhya point of view, the opponent shows that their destruction of all actions is by enjoyment,

original: karmaikaṃ janmakṛt sarvaṃ nopādānalayaśruteḥ /
analyzed: karma ekam janma kṛt sarvam na upādāna laya śruteḥ
translated: All actions produce one birth, not the accumulation of grasping, because it is heard.

original: indratvādiphalaṃ vede'pyucyate tat pṛthak pṛthak // //
analyzed: indra tva ādi phalam vede api ucyate tat pṛthak pṛthak
translated: The fruits of Indrahood and so on are also mentioned separately in the Veda.

original: iha janmaprayāṇamadhye yatkṛtaṃ śubhāśubhakarmajātaṃ tatsarvaṃ
analyzed: iha janma prayāṇa madhye yat kṛtam śubha aśubha karma jātam tat sarvam
translated: Here, all the good and bad actions done in the interval between birth and death,

original: pradhānopasarjanabhāvenāvasthitaṃ prayāṇābhivyaktaṃ yugapadeva samucchritamekameva janma
analyzed: pradhāna upasarjana bhāvena avasthitam prayāṇa abhivyaktam yugapad eva samucchritam ekam eva janma
translated: The birth is one only, which is manifested by the departure, existing in the form of principal and subordinate, simultaneously raised.

original: karoti / na tu janmāntare phaladānāyāvaśiṣṭaṃ bhavati pratipālayati / kriyārūpatvāt🔽karmaṇa ārabdhakāryasyānupapattirityekabhavikakarmavādinaḥ / tataśca prakṛtajanmanaiva
analyzed: karoti na tu janmāntare phala dānāya avaśiṣṭam bhavati pratipālayati kriyā rūpa tvāt  karmaṇaḥ ārabdha kāryasya anupapattiḥ iti eka bhavika karma vādinaḥ tatas ca prakṛta janmanā eva
translated: It produces only one birth, which is simultaneously manifested by the departure [from the body], but not remaining to give its fruit in another birth, because of being an action.

original: teṣāṃ prāktanasarvakarmakṣayo'numito'bhinavakarmakṣayaśca jñānādinā jātaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām prāktana sarva karma kṣaya unumitaḥ abhinava karma kṣayaḥ ca jñāna ādinā jātaḥ
translated: Because of the impossibility of the action whose fruit has begun, those who maintain the doctrine of karma lasting for one existence [say this]. And from that, the exhaustion of all the previous karma in this very birth that has begun, and the exhaustion of the new karma produced by knowledge etc. is inferred.

original: tadudbhūto guṇatattvordhvabhogyakarmasantatiḥ / etannirākaroti neti / naiṣa🔽niyamaḥ / kintu kānicit karmāṇi dvitīyādijanmakartṛṇyapi santi / kuta ityāha upādāna
analyzed: tad udbhūtaḥ guṇa tattva ūrdhva bhogya karma santatiḥ etat nirākaroti na iti na eṣa  niyamaḥ kintu kānicid karmāṇi dvitīya ādi janma kartṛṇi api santi kutas iti āha upādāna
translated: The continuation of karma to be experienced in the higher principles produced by that [knowledge] - this he refutes with 'No'. This is not

original: iti / upādāne prakṛtau karmaṇāṃ layaḥ saṃskārarūpeṇāvasthānaṃ śrūyate yataḥ /
analyzed: iti upādāne prakṛtau karmaṇām layaḥ saṃskāra rūpeṇa avasthānam śrūyate yatas
translated: a rule, but some actions exist even for the agents of the second and subsequent births. From what? He says 'in the prakriti'. It is heard that the dissolution of actions, their remaining in the form of impressions, is in the prakriti.

original: prakṛtau karmasaṃskāra sthitaḥ sarva iti / tatastu tatpākakālamāsādya punarbhogāya pravartata
analyzed: prakṛtau karma saṃskāra sthitaḥ sarvaḥ iti tatas tu tad pāka kālam āsādya punar bhogāya pravartata
translated: All the impressions of actions remain in the prakriti. Therefore, having reached the time of their ripening, they again operate for experience.

original: iti / na kevalamihaiva karma śrūyate / yāvadvede'pītyāha indratvādiphalamiti / vājapeyena
analyzed: iti na kevalam iha eva karma śrūyate yāvat vede api iti āha indra tva ādi phalam iti vājapeyena
translated: Thus. It is not only heard here, but also in the Veda, he says the fruit of Indrahood etc. By the Vajapeya

original: svārājyakāmo yajeta // iti svarājyamindratvaṃ tatphalaṃ karma /
analyzed: svārājya kāmaḥ yajeta iti svarājyam indra tvam tad phalam karma
translated: sacrifice, one desiring self-sovereignty should sacrifice. Self-sovereignty is Indrahood, that is its fruit, the action.

original: ādigrahaṇāt svargādiphalaṃ niṣiddhabrahmahatyādi narakaphalaṃ ca śrūyate / tat pṛthak🔽pṛthagiti / janma karotīti saṃbandhaḥ / parasparaviruddhaphalānāṃ yugapadekajanmakaraṇāsaṃ🔽bhavāt / na ca nāśo'pi karmaṇa ityavaśyaṃ janmāntaraphaladānāya tāni
analyzed: ādi grahaṇāt svarga ādi phalam niṣiddha brahmahatyā ādi naraka phalam ca śrūyate tat pṛthak  pṛthak iti janma karoti iti saṃbandhaḥ paraspara viruddha phalānām yugapad eka janma karaṇa asaṃbhavaḥ  bhavāt na ca nāśaḥ api karmaṇaḥ iti avaśyam janma antara phala dānāya tāni
translated: By the word etc. the fruit of heaven etc. and the fruit of hell from the prohibited Brahman-slaughter etc. are heard. That is separately🔽each. The connection is it produces birth. Because it is impossible for those having mutually contradictory fruits to produce one birth simultaneously. And since the destruction of the action is also not possible, it must be accepted that they necessarily give their fruits in a subsequent birth.

original: pratipādayantītyabhyupagantavyamityasaṃbhava evaibhavikakarmavādasya / taduktam phalati yadi
analyzed: pratipādayanti iti abhyupagantavyam iti asaṃbhavaḥ eva aibhavika karma vādasya tat uktam phalati yadi
translated: Thus the doctrine of the existence of action is impossible. It is said: If it does not bear fruit,

original: na sarvaṃ tat kadācit tadaiva dhuruvamaparamabhuktaṃ karmaśāstrīyamāste /
analyzed: na sarvam tat kadācid tadā eva dhuruvam aparam abhuktam karma śāstrīyam āste citrā
translated: then at that very time, some other action prescribed by the scriptures remains uneaten, like a burden.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: nanvetāvatā''rabdhakāryaṃ karmaiva na saṃbhavatītyuktam / ko'nyathā etadāha / kintu
analyzed: nanu etāvatā ārabdha kāryam karma eva na saṃbhavati iti uktam kaḥ nyathā etat āha kintu
translated: But how is it that only this much has been said, that action whose effect has begun does not exist at all? Who else would say this? But

original: sarveṇa dharmādharmātmakena puruṣakarmaṇā svaphalānugrāhiṇā prakṛtisaṃskāra eva🔽kāryaḥ / tathā dṛṣṭatvāt kṛṣyāderapi puruṣavyāpārasya / satu tenāpyārabdha eva /
analyzed: sarveṇa dharma adharma ātmakena puruṣa karmaṇā sva phala anugrāhiṇā prakṛti saṃskāraḥ eva  kāryaḥ tathā dṛṣṭa tvāt kṛṣi ādeḥ api puruṣa vyāpārasya satu tena api ārabdhaḥ eva
translated: By all the actions of the soul, which are of the nature of virtue and vice, which are conducive to their own fruits, the modification of primordial matter is to be produced.

original: saṃskārastvasau svaparipākāpekṣaḥ pratibandhakatīvrakarmaphalabhogakṣayāpekṣayā kvacid
analyzed: saṃskāraḥ tu asau sva paripāka apekṣaḥ pratibandhaka tīvra karma phala bhoga kṣaya apekṣayā kvacid
translated: Because it is seen that even agriculture and other human activities are produced by that. But that modification, which depends on its own maturity, depending on the exhaustion of the enjoyment of the fruits of very strong actions that obstruct it,

original: viśiṣṭabhuvanabhogakṣayāpekṣayā viruddhakarmaphalasahakārisahāyaḥ kevalo vā
analyzed: viśiṣṭa bhuvana bhoga kṣaya apekṣayā viruddha karma phala sahakāri sahāyaḥ kevalaḥ vā
translated: depending on the exhaustion of the enjoyment of some particular world, assisted by the fruits of conflicting actions, or alone,

original: kasmiścijjanmani kadācit taphalaṃ nikṣepamiva puruṣāya dāsyatītyasarvajñaiḥ
analyzed: kasmiścid janmani kadācid nikṣepam iva puruṣāya dāsyati iti asarvajñaiḥ
translated: will sometimes in some birth give its fruit to the soul, like a deposit. Therefore, by those who are not omniscient,

original: karmavipākavaicitryaṃ nāvadhārayituṃ śakyata iti janmāntaraphaladakarmasaṃbhavāduktavadeva
analyzed: karma vipāka vaicitryam nā avadhārayitum śakyate iti janma antara phala da karma saṃbhavāt ukta vat eva
translated: the variety of the ripening of actions cannot be ascertained. Therefore, because of the possibility of actions that give fruits in another birth, as stated,

original: kevalitaiva sāṃkhyamuktānāmiti // //
analyzed: kevali tā eva sāṃkhya muktānām iti
translated: the liberation of the liberated souls of the Sāṃkhyas is only solitary.

original: nanu yuṣmadāgame'pi kevalitvamātmanaḥ śrūyate / kathamityāha
analyzed: nanu yuṣmad āgame pi kevali tvam ātmanaḥ śrūyate katham iti āha
translated: But in your scriptures also, the solitariness of the soul is heard. How? He says:

original: aṅguṣṭhamātrabhuvane kaivalyaṃ saṃbhavet paśoḥ /vijñānayogasaṃnyāsairbhogādvā
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha mātra bhuvane kaivalyam saṃbhavet paśoḥ vijñāna yoga saṃnyāsaiḥ bhogāt vā
translated: In the world of the size of a thumb, the liberation of the individual soul is possible through the yoga of knowledge, renunciation, or

original: karmaṇaḥ kṣayāt // //
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ kṣayāt
translated: the exhaustion of the fruits of actions.

original: aṅguṣṭhamātrādisaṃjñakanivāsasthāne kalābhuvane vijñānena
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha mātra ādi saṃjñaka nivāsa sthāne kalā bhuvane vijñānena
translated: In the abode of Maya, the abode of the individual soul, by knowledge

original: māyāpuruṣavivekaviṣayeṇa / yogena pratyāharādyaṅgopakṛtena cittajayātmanā /🔽māyāvivekaphalena saṃnyāsena vā karmaṇaḥ sarva
analyzed: māyā puruṣa viveka viṣayeṇa yogena pratyāhara ādi aṅga upakṛtena citta jaya ātmanā  māyā viveka phalena saṃnyāsena vā karmaṇaḥ
translated: in the form of discrimination between Maya and the individual soul, and by Yoga, which is aided by the limbs such as pratyahara, and which consists in the conquest of the mind,🔽or by renunciation, which is the fruit of the discrimination between Maya and the individual soul, and which is the cessation of all actions,

original: mīśvarāyaitaditīśvarārpitasarvakarmaṇastatphalaviṣayeṇa bhogenaiva vā sarvakarmakṣayāt
analyzed: mī īśvarāya etat iti īśvara arpita sarva karmaṇaḥ tad phala viṣayeṇa bhogena eva vā sarva karma kṣayāt
translated: or by enjoyment itself, which is the fruit of all actions offered to God with the thought this is for God, and which is the destruction of all actions,

original: sarvathā bhoktṛtvanivṛttinimittaṃ kaivalyaṃ saṃbhavati tatraiva / na tu bhavaduktāviti // //
analyzed: sarvathā bhoktṛ tva nivṛtti nimittam kaivalyam saṃbhavati tatra eva na tu bhavat uktau iti
translated: in any case, liberation, which is the cause of the cessation of the state of being an enjoyer, is possible there alone, not in the liberation described by you.

original: nanu tadeva kaivalyamasmākaṃ mokṣo bhaviṣyatītyāha
analyzed: nanu tat eva kaivalyam asmākam mokṣaḥ bhaviṣyati iti āha
translated: But that very liberation will be our liberation, he says

original: jātaṃ muktyarthamātmāyamitthamātmalayaḥ phalam /
analyzed: jātam mukti artham ātmā ayam ittham ātma layaḥ phalam
translated: The fruit of the dissolution of the self in this way is for the self, which is born for liberation.

original: upādāne layasyaiva dṛkkriyāguṇasaṃkṣayāt // //
analyzed: upādāne layasya eva dṛkkriyā guṇa saṃkṣayāt
translated: Because of the destruction of the qualities of seeing and action in the dissolution of the material cause.

original: yattadapi kaivalyaṃ muktiriṣṭā / tadapi hi malasadbhāvādātmanaḥ pratyuta
analyzed: yat tat api kaivalyam muktiḥ iṣṭā tat api hi mala sadbhāvāt ātmanaḥ pratyuta
translated: Even that liberation is accepted as liberation. But even that, due to the existence of impurity,

original: akalāvasthāvat kiñcijjñatvakartṛtvayorapyabhāvāt phalamātmanāśa eva bhavatāmapi
analyzed: akala avasthā vat kiñcid jña tva kartṛ tvayoḥ api abhāvāt phalam ātma nāśaḥ eva bhavatām api
translated: is rather the destruction of the self, like the state of being without parts, because of the absence of the knowledge of something and the absence of agency, even for you.

original: guṇopādānāvyaktalayo mokṣo yataḥ // //
analyzed: guṇa upādāna avyakta layaḥ mokṣaḥ yatas
translated: Because liberation is the dissolution of the material cause, which is the cause of the qualities.

original: evaṃ sāṃkhyapakṣamapyābhāsyopasaṃhartuṃ sarvān pratyāha
analyzed: evam sāṃkhya pakṣam api ābhāsya upasaṃhartum sarvān pratyāha
translated: Thus, having refuted the Sāṃkhya view, he says this to all in order to conclude:

original: mūḍhānāṃ jyeṣṭhamallāste yeṣāṃ svātmā'pi naśyati /
analyzed: mūḍhānām jyeṣṭha mallāḥ te yeṣām sva ātmā api naśyati
translated: They are the foremost fools, whose own self is destroyed.

original: jñātṝṇāṃ paṇḍitaṃmanyāḥ śikhāsaṃkrāntivādinaḥ // //
analyzed: jñātṝṇām paṇḍitaṃmanyāḥ śikhā saṃkrānti vādinaḥ
translated: The knowers who consider themselves wise, who propound the doctrine of the transference of the tuft,

original: ta ete sarvavādino mūḍhapradhānāḥ śreyor'rthibhirdūrataraṃ parihāryāḥ /
analyzed: te ete sarva vādinaḥ mūḍha pradhānāḥ śreyaḥ ṛthibhiḥ dūrataram parihāryāḥ
translated: All these proponents are to be avoided from afar by those who seek the highest good,

original: yeṣāmaśreyasyevātmanāśe tatsadṛśe vā paraśreyobuddhiḥ / apuruṣārthabhūtaḥ sarveṣāṃ
analyzed: yeṣām aśreyasi eva ātma nāśe tad sadṛśe vā para śreyaḥ buddhiḥ apuruṣa artha bhūtaḥ sarveṣām
translated: whose intellect is in the destruction of the self, which is not the highest good, or in the highest good of others, which is not the human goal.

original: mokṣa ityarthaḥ / tathāhi jñāturjñeyasya mataṅgapārameśvaravṛttau /
analyzed: mokṣaḥ iti arthaḥ tathā hi jñātuḥ jñeyasya mataṅga pārameśvara vṛttau
translated: The meaning is that liberation is not the highest goal for all. Thus, in the commentary of Mataṅga and Parameśvara on the Jñātri,

original: asmābhiranyatra ityuktvoddhṛtametadvacanaṃ śivayogasāre taduktaṃ
analyzed: asmābhiḥ anyatra iti uktvā uddhṛtam etat vacanam śivayogasāre tat uktam
translated: it is said that this statement has been extracted by us elsewhere. It is remembered in the Śivayogasāra as follows:

original: mantravārttikaṭīkāyāmityevaṃ smaryata iti tatrasthā saṃkhyākā ṭippaṇī
analyzed: mantravārttika ṭīkāyām iti evam smaryate iti tatrasthā pṛ saṃkhyākā ṭippaṇī
translated: In the commentary on the Mantravartikā, it is said that the numbered footnote there

original: draṣṭavyā / vā jñapterabhāvāt sarvavādinām / ātmanāśasamo mokṣo jñatvavyaktau
analyzed: draṣṭavyāḥ vā jñapteḥ abhāvāt sarva vādinām ātma nāśa samaḥ mokṣaḥ jña tva vyaktau
translated: should be seen. Or, because of the absence of cognition, liberation is the same as the destruction of the self for all proponents,🔽but for others, in the manifestation of the knower,

original: paratra tu // iti / nanu saṃkrāntivādināṃ nātmanāśo vimuktāvityāha jñātṛṇāṃ
analyzed: paratra tu iti nanu saṃkrāntivādinām na ātma nāśaḥ vimuktau iti āha jñātṛṇām
translated: Now, for those who propound the transference, there is no destruction of the self in liberation. He says: For the knowers,

original: paṇḍitaṃmanyā iti śikhā śaktiḥ / tatsaṃkrāntivādino muktāvapaṇḍitā eva / yato nāsmāt
analyzed: paṇḍitaṃmanyāḥ iti śikhā śaktiḥ tad saṃkrānti vādinaḥ muktau apaṇḍitāḥ eva yatas na asmāt
translated: Those who consider themselves learned, i.e. the crest-jewel, are the power. Those who speak of its descent are not learned in liberation, because

original: prasaṅgānmucyata ityuktam śambhureva hi tatrāpi sarvaṃ veti karoti ca iti // //
analyzed: prasaṅgāt mucyate iti uktam śambhuḥ eva hi tatra api sarvam vā iti karoti ca iti
translated: it is said that they are not freed from this consequence. For it is said that only Śiva knows and does everything there.

original: yadyevaṃ sarveṣāmeva mokṣaśāstrāṇāṃ muktavad bādhitatvāt parasparavirodhācca
analyzed: yadi evam sarveṣām eva mokṣa śāstrāṇām mukta vat bādhita tvāt paraspara virodhāt ca
translated: If it is so, then all the scriptures on liberation are contradicted by the liberated one, and because of mutual contradiction,

original: kiṃ prāmāṇyam / evaṃ netyāha
analyzed: kim prāmāṇyam evam na iti āha
translated: how can they be authoritative? Thus, he says no.

original: vastunyūnatvamanyeṣāṃ rāgādūrdhvamabhāṣaṇāt /
analyzed: vastu nyūna tvam anyeṣām rāgāt ūrdhvam abhāṣaṇāt
translated: The others have less substance, because they do not speak beyond passion.

original: tena māyānatītatvājjñātāraḥ sadmasu sthitāḥ // //🔽nahi sarveṇa pramāṇena sarvārthena bhavitavyamityalpārthaprakāśakatvena
analyzed: tena māyā anatīta tvāt jñātāraḥ sadmasu sthitāḥ  nahi sarveṇa pramāṇena sarva arthena bhavitavyam iti alpa artha prakāśaka tvena
translated: Therefore, because they are beyond māyā, they are knowers, dwelling in the abodes.🔽It is not necessary that everything should be by all means. Therefore, like perception etc., the other means of knowledge also illuminate only a small part of the object.

original: pratyakṣādivadevānyānyapi pramāṇānyeva / kathaṃ svalpārthadarśitvameṣāmityāha
analyzed: pratyakṣa ādi vat eva anyāni api pramāṇāni eva katham su alpa artha darśi tvam eṣām iti āha
translated: How do they have the ability to show only a small part of the object? He says

original: rāgādūrdhvamabhāṣaṇāditi / rāgavidyāditattvajātaṃ ca tadūrdhvaprakriyā
analyzed: rāgāt ūrdhvam abhāṣaṇāt iti rāga vidyā ādi tattva jātam ca tad ūrdhva prakriyā
translated: because they do not speak beyond passion. The truth of passion, knowledge etc. is beyond that process.

original: guṇādibhyastadūrdhvaṃ citaḥ / ūrdhvaśabdasamānārtho'yamūrdhvaśabdaḥ / tasya
analyzed: guṇa ādibhyaḥ tat ūrdhvam citaḥ  ūrdhva śabda samāna arthaḥ yam ūrdhva śabdaḥ tasya
translated: And beyond that, the intellect is from the qualities etc. This word beyond has the same meaning as the word beyond. That

original: rāgādūrdhvaṃ samastatattvajātasyānukternyūnadarśitvaṃ teṣām / yadyevamāgamāntaraiḥ
analyzed: rāgāt ūrdhvam samasta tattva jātasya anukteḥ nyūna darśi tvam teṣām yadi evam āgama antaraiḥ
translated: Since it is not stated that the group of all tattvas above rajas is seen by them, they are shown to be less. If it is so,

original: kiṃ prāpyata ityāha tena māyānatītatvāditi / yena rāgādūrdhvaṃ tairna dṛṣṭaṃ tena
analyzed: kim prāpyate iti āha tena māyā anatīta tvāt iti yena rāgāt ūrdhvam taiḥ na dṛṣṭam tena
translated: what is attained by other scriptures? He says, Therefore, because they have not transcended māyā. By which they have not seen above rajas, by that

original: māyātatvādadhaste jñātāro darśanāntaramuktāstattvabhuvanaskandheṣu līnāḥ / kasya kasmin
analyzed: māyā tatvāt adhas te jñātāraḥ darśana antara muktāḥ tattva bhuvana skandheṣu līnāḥ kasya kasmin
translated: they are said to be liberated from other views, merged in the tattvas, worlds, and aggregates. If it is asked in which one is merged,

original: laya iti cet / tadetad darśitamāgamaprāmāṇyopanyāse // //
analyzed: laye iti ced tat etat darśitam āgama prāmāṇya upanyāse
translated: that has been shown in the presentation of the authority of the scriptures.

original: svena jñānakāṇḍe upasaṃhartumāha
analyzed: svena jñāna kāṇḍe upasaṃhartum āha
translated: In order to conclude by himself in the section on knowledge, he says

original: ityevaṃ vādigītāni phalānyuktāni leśataḥ /
analyzed: iti evam vādi gītāni phalāni uktāni leśataḥ
translated: Thus, the fruits mentioned in the songs of the proponents have been stated briefly.

original: tatsādhaneṣu śiṣyāṇāmapravṛttiphalaṃ prati // //
analyzed: tad sādhaneṣu śiṣyāṇām apravṛtti phalam prati
translated: For the disciples who do not engage in the means of attaining that, the fruit is liberation.

original: iti sadyojyotiḥśivācāryakṛtā paramokṣanirāsakārikā
analyzed: iti sadyojyotiḥśiva ācārya kṛtā para mokṣa nirāsa kārikā
translated: Thus ends the commentary on the refutation of supreme liberation composed by Sadyojyotiḥ Śivācārya.

original: samāptā //🔽sarvavādisiddhāni phalāni muktilakṣaṇānyeva saṃkṣepeṇoktāni / kimarthaṃ pratyuktamiti
analyzed: samāptā  sarva vādi siddhāni phalāni mukti lakṣaṇāni eva saṃkṣepeṇa uktāni kimartham pratyuktam iti
translated: It is completed.🔽The fruits characterized by liberation, which are established by all proponents, have been stated briefly. If it is asked for what purpose they are refuted,

original: cedetaduktam / phalasādhanaṃ śāstramanavadhārya nikṛṣṭaphale pravartanta iti
analyzed: ced etat uktam phala sādhanam śāstram an avadhārya nikṛṣṭa phale pravartante iti
translated: this has been stated: Without determining the means of attaining the fruit, they engage in inferior fruits.

original: śreyo'rthibhirevā'yogavyavacchedenātraiva pravartanīyam / asmāddhi pararūpaṃ niḥśreyasaṃ
analyzed: śreyaḥ ṛthibhiḥ eva ayoga vyavacchedena atra eva pravartanīyam asmāt hi para rūpam niḥśreyasam
translated: Those who seek the highest good should engage in this very [practice] through the exclusion of non-connection. For from this, the highest good has another form.

original: saṃpādyata iti /
analyzed: saṃpādyate iti
translated: Those who seek the highest good should engage in this very [path] by excluding the non-union [with Brahman]. For from this, the highest good is accomplished.

original: etadrauravavṛttikṛnmatadhiyā dīkṣākramāt kārikāḥ
translated: These kārikās, which are not understood by the wise who wrote the Raurava commentary,

original: sarvānyāgamamokṣadūṣaṇagatā gāmbhīryato naiva yāḥ //
analyzed: sarva anya āgama mokṣa dūṣaṇa gatāḥ gāmbhīryataḥ nā eva yāḥ
translated: which do not have profundity in the matter of refuting all other scriptures that lead to liberation,

original: svalpajñairavagāhitāḥ kila yatastadrāmakaṇṭhastvimaṃ🔽tannārāyaṇakaṇṭhasūnurakarodāsāṃ vivekaṃ sphuṭam //🔽itiśrīmadbhaṭṭanārāyaṇakaṇṭhātmajaśrībhaṭṭarāmakaṇṭhaviracitā
analyzed: su alpa jñaiḥ avagāhitāḥ kila yatas tad rāma kaṇṭhaḥ tu imam  tat nārāyaṇa kaṇṭha sūnuḥ akarot āsām vivekam sphuṭam  iti śrīmat bhaṭṭa nārāyaṇakaṇṭha ātmaja śrī bhaṭṭa rāmakaṇṭha viracitā
translated: since they are said to have been understood only by those of little knowledge,🔽the son of Nārāyaṇa Kaṇṭha, Rāma Kaṇṭha, has clearly distinguished them.🔽Thus ends the commentary on the kārikās refuting the highest liberation,

original: paramokṣanirāsakārikāvṛttiḥ samāptā //
translated: composed by the illustrious Rāma Kaṇṭha, the son of Bhaṭṭa Nārāyaṇa Kaṇṭha.
